company: Federal Home Loan Bank of Des Moines
details:
Database Administrator IIIIf you have experience with developing, tuning and troubleshooting data base systems, strong SQL and T-SQL, SSIS and SRS skills, apply for the Bank's opening for a Database Administrator III. r OThis role is responsible for the build, ongoing maintenance, performance tuning, failure avoidance, detection and repair of the databases associated with the Bank's processing environment. The DBA team is also responsible for making recommendations to ensure IT solutions are aligned with the corporate strategy and the long term success of the organization.Responsibilities:
Analyze and evaluate reported problems, take responsibility for resolution, and prevent recurrence.
Develop, implement, administer, and maintain, logical and physical data models to support business, performance, reliability, and security requirements.
Develop, test, implement, troubleshoot, and support data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.
Maintain technical documentation related for the data warehouse and other database systems.
Coach, train and mentor other employees on proper access and use of database systems.
Set standards, guidelines and procedures to utilize the corporate database systems.
Support use of front-end data access, reporting, and analysis tools.
Tune data warehouse and other database systems for optimal performance and reliability.
Manage departmental internal controls and regulatory issues. 
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent professional experience 
5+ years of professional experience developing, tuning, troubleshooting, and supporting data base systems, data warehouses, and SQL required 
Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server including experience with database administration, T-SQL (a plus), SSIS, and SSRS required
Ability to initiate and lead improvements to systems, methods, and procedures 
Self-starter with the ability to initiate, complete, and oversee required tasks with limited oversight 
Ability to diagnose and resolve computer related problems quickly and effectively 
Excellent attention to detail 
Excellent communication and listening skills and ability to work well in a team environment 
Working knowledge of other database systems, including Oracle and DB2 a plus
Working knowledge of server, data network, and storage infrastructure concepts 
Interpersonal, creative, and communication skills that allow effective, proactive working relationships in a team-oriented environment
title: Database Administrator

details:
DBA Lead - DBA Shift Lead, DBA Platform Lead, DBA Platform Sub-LeadSeeking an Database Administrator. The candidate will have 10 years of experience demonstrating comprehensive knowledge of key tasks on a large high visibility IT programThis role will lead the Database team in the Administration, development, test, or of the Database platforms supporting functions across one or more teams or clients, including designing, implementing and maintaining new databases, backup/recovery and configuration management. Install database management systems (DBMS) and provide input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance.This role will lead efforts to accelerate development of automation scripts for deployment, configuration, security hardening and patch management of standard database and Web Service platforms using Accenture pre-developed automation assets. Optionally integrate with database virtualization tools such as Delphix to automate the migration of data across virtual infrastructure and reduce the time to deliver services for cross-environment data synchronization for testingUtilize vendor scripting tools and processes, including but not limited to software distribution, backups, performance measurement, tuning, and license and asset management to allow automated as well as remote systems management of the server environment to reduce time to deliver services Key Duties include:
Working with other teams to consolidate database instances and storage using capacity and performance analysis tools to identify underutilized instances, duplicate copies of data and identify associated server, network and storage resources that can be "right sized" in preparation for transition to new CoLo datacenter or hybrid cloud.
Evaluate utilization of Exadata systems workloads to determine the strategy for use and migration moving forward. Some consolidation of Exadatas is expected as the existing workload moves to more cloud-friendly, lighter weight database platforms readily available in all major cloud service provider environments.
Explore licensing/hosting opportunities for Exadata within Oracle's Cloud (assuming FedRamped) to leverage cost incentives for the high-density mission critical databases.
Lead the database engineering team in integrating, implementing, and operating OIT Database systems (Datacom/DB, IBM DB2, Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle) across the entire enterprise and with cloud service providers to support 24x7x365 availability.
Provide leadership in problem determination/analysis and isolate system problems utilizing diagnostic and system management tools (i.e. system dumps and system/component traces, monitoring tools, vendor problem data bases).
Maintain security hardened baseline configurations and deploy security (patches), software maintenance (patches) and new software releases and supporting products infrastructure as directed by the system owner, policy, or the Cybersecurity Directorate.
Lead the Engineering, integration, implementation, and operation of a virtualization strategy to include Database server consolidation, storage consolidation, and automation. Automation includes seamless Database provisioning, and non-disruptive workflow/application/data migrations.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of all procedures, infrastructure diagrams, system configuration and baseline standards, implementation plans, system back out plans, system recovery plans, maintenance plans, system upgrades, and all system changes.
Provide leadership in process, management and resolution of all event, warning, alert, as well as alarm messages. Contractor shall design and implement automated responses to system issues (e.g., automatic failover, resource allocation adjustments).
PREFERED REQUIREMENTS
Design and builds relational databases. Performs data access analysis design, and archive/recovery design and implementation.
Development of strategies for data acquisitions, archive recovery, and implementation of a database.
Development of data warehousing blueprints, evaluating hardware and software platforms, and integrating systems.
Reviewing and development of object and data models and the metadata repository to structure the data for better management and quicker access
Microsoft SQL Server
Licensing/hosting of Exadata within Oracle's Cloud
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS3 to 10 years of experience and a B.S. degree. Bachelor of Science (BS) can be substituted with an additional 4 years of related experience
3 years experience with Datacom/DB
2 years experience with IBM DB2
3 years experience with Oracle systems
3 years experience with Oracle Data Guard for multi-site failover and smarter use of standby databases for reporting and analysis functions, rather than sitting idle awaiting failover operations.
4 years experience Exadata systems
US Citizenship

details:
SQL Database Administrator Job Description

 

Johnson Service Group, Inc. (JSG) is a leader in the staffing services industry, with over 30 years of experience investing in people and companies. We can be found locally in more than 30 offices throughout the United States and Canada and continue to experience tremendous growth.  

 

But don’t just trust us – let our accolades tell the story.  For the past four years, JSG has been named to three prominent Staffing Industry Analyst (SIA) award lists:  Largest U.S. Staffing Firms, Fastest Growing U.S. Staffing Firms and Largest U.S. Engineering Staffing Firms.  

 

As the SQL Database Administrator, your responsibilities will be as follows:

 


Installation, Configuration and Maintenance of MS SQL 2016 including but not limited to




Creation and maintenance of Stored Procedures
Direct SQL Administration tasks
Storage and Capacity planning
Monitoring and performance tuning
Troubleshooting issues directly related to SQL
Assist in creating in maintaining High Availability for SQL


 


Perform Daily maintenance tasks for MS Dynamics




Monitoring health of the Application and performance tuning
Troubleshooting issues within the application structure and relationships with MS SQL
Making configuration changes as needed


  

A successful SQL Database Administrator candidate will possess the following:



3 – 5 years SQL Database Administration utilizing SQL 2012 or higher.

Excellent Interpersonal and Communications skills


Proficiency working in a fast-paced environment


Experience working with cross functional teams and reporting to Executive level management

title: Database Administrator

details:
NWN is recognized as one of the top 16 Cisco partners in the U.S. and a leader in the IT services industry with many awards and elite certifications from Hewlett Packard, NetApp, EMC, Microsoft and VMware to name only a few. With over 600 employees in 12 locations across the U.S. the company is on a fast track to even greater success. If you're a top performer looking for a new opportunity we want to talk to you!NWN has an opening for a SQL Database Administrator (DBA) who will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining production databases, SQL queries, procedures, scripts and objects, including tables, primary and foreign key relationships, triggers, constraints, etc. In this role, you will perform advanced performance analysis and tuning within SQL Server; as well as, the other tiers of the infrastructure to identify and resolve bottlenecks and problems, and you'll ensure that databases are working properly in conjunction with applications. You must have the ability to complete data mining efforts and ad hoc analysis to ensure a firm understanding of source system data and how it relates to business requirements. And you will work closely with the development team to optimize SQL queries, support coding best practices and implement optimal coding techniques. SQL DBA Responsibilities:  Maintain uptime of all database applications from a database perspective Develop, test and deploy SQL changes Manage the day-to-day operations of database systems and ensure that the systems and applications function effectively Make sure that the database systems provide sufficient computing power to deliver the desired level of business performance Test new software or software versions such as database server upgrades Initiate and complete recovery action after system failures when required Provide advice to developers and users on database standards, data structures and terminology Prepare technical reports on the operation of systems Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities when needed Create ad-hoc reports
 Required Qualifications: 5+ years MSSQL experience Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools Exceptionally skilled in troubleshooting query performance Excellent written and verbal communication Flexible, team player, "get-it-done personality Ability to organize and plan work independently Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams Ability to analyze data to find inconsistencies MCTS, MCITP, and/or MVP certifications a plus
 Data warehouse experience a plus
title: Database Administrator

details: Our client, an Insurance Company in Lincoln, RI is in need of (1) Sr SQL Database Administrator for a 6-month contract to hire opportunity. The SQL DBA would be responsible to utilize tools to monitor the performance, reliability and availability of the corporate database environments. The SQL DBA would be part of a team of 10 and be responsible for 600+ Microsoft SQL server installs with high availability Microsoft clustering, and database mirroring/availability groups across multiple data centers. In addition, they would support day-to-day operational tasks including management of accounts, handling incident and service request tickets, priority incident resolution, and operational maintenance activities such as database backups and restores, and SQL job and script maintenance. The DBA would also manage the storage environments for the SQL Server databases, including planning for additional storage, maintaining optimal sizing, monitoring space and providing growth statistics. Required Skills:    7+ years’ experience as a SQL database administrator Excellent communication skills both written and verbal Understanding of Availability Groups (AG groups) Experience deploying and troubleshooting SQL transactional replication and Availability Groups Willing to learn new technologies as the company continues to grow     Nice to have skills:   Experience with NetApp is a plus as that is where SQL sits Experience with MongoDB database administration, Teradata, NoSQL and cloud-based records management is a plus and would give the DBA a huge advantage Certifications are nice to have but not a requirement

title: Database Administrator

details: Responsible for the day-to-day maintenance and monitoring of Oracle and SQL server databases. Interact with development staff in all areas of database design and operation.  RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:  * Refresh non-production databases. * Perform routine, day-to-day database administrator duties and observe more senior database administrators in order to build skills in data modeling, SQL and PL/SQL tuning, application tuning, creation of database objects, data modeling, utilities, UNIX commands and UNIX programs. * Participate on committee that sets SQL and PL/SQL programming standards. * Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives. * Review documented processes and procedures. * Develop understanding of and stay current with advances in information technology by reading manuals, trade periodicals, and technical reports relating to Oracle and SQL Server databases. * Provide technical assistance to other Information Services personnel. * Maintain confidentiality of information processed. * Participate in on-call rotation for production database support.  ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:  * Make technical recommendations and implement policies and standards relating to the architectural design of databases, network communications, data access and security requirements, and backup and recovery procedures for production and development databases. * Create and refresh non-production databases. * Monitor and manage database growth and size requirements. * Plan, develop, test, and tune databases. * Assist and mentor development staff in data modeling, SQL and PL/SQL tuning, application tuning, creation of database objects, utilities, UNIX commands and UNIX programs. * Install third-party applications for testing and implementation in production. * Lead committee the set SQL and PL/SQL programming standards. * Develop and maintain SQL and UNIX programs to monitor database conditions and activities. * Identify application and/or SQL performance problems and assist in their resolution. * Analyze, review, and alter database parameters and structure to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements. * Consults with users to identify current database requirements and clarify objectives. * Document current, revised, and new processes and procedures. * Perform prototyping and database tuning and optimizing. * Stay up to date with advances in information technology by reading manuals, trade periodicals, and technical reports relating to Oracle and SQL Server databases. * Provide technical assistance to other Information Services personnel. * Work with minimum supervision and exercise sufficient discretion and independent judgment. * Mentors peers and IT personnel. * Manage relationship with Oracle and Windows Support. * Analyze and plan for future database, server, storage, and network requirements. * Gather database statistics for trend analysis. * Research and plan implementation of new database features and enhancements. * Design database growth management strategies. * Design database backup and recovery strategy including usage of standby databases for Business Resumption Plan. * Produce periodic reports for management and staff. * Work with no supervision and exercise discretion and independent judgment. This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field required. Certification or progress toward certification of, industry-recognized professional designation in Oracle and SQL preferred and encouraged. Combinations of relevant education and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company's learning philosophy, is required. Oracle Certified Associate, Oracle Certified Professional and/or Microsoft Certified Solutions Assistant: Sql Server preferred.  EXPERIENCE: Database Administrator Three to five years experience within an IT environment which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities. One year relevant experience with Oracle and/or SQL Server databases preferred. Experience within the insurance industry highly preferred.  Senior Database Administrator Five years experience within an IT environment which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities. Three years relevant experience with Oracle and/or SQL Server databases or maintaining a production environment preferred. Experience within the insurance industry highly preferred.  SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:  * Ability to troubleshoot client/server problems. * Ability and proficiency in the use of computers and company standard software specific to position. * General understanding of database administration. * Basic knowledge of Oracle and/or SQL Server database management tools. * Basic knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL, UNIX commands. * Excellent oral and written communication skills. * Ability to apply the principles of logical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. * Ability to comprehend the consequences of various problem situations and to make sound decisions or to refer problems to appropriate people for decision making. * Ability to manage multiple projects and meet necessary deadlines. * Ability to work varying hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays as required. * Ability to perform other assignments at locations outside the office.  ADDITIONAL SKAs REQUIRED FOR SENIOR DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR:  * Ability to work closely with Database engineers to implement standards, policies and procedures developed. * Ability to document and develop standard operating procedures for day to day activities. * Ability to make technical recommendations. Demonstrated high level of competency in Oracle and/or SQL Server database administration. * Thorough knowledge of and ability to use Oracle and/or SQL Server database utilities and management tools. * Thorough knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL, UNIX commands, and shell programming. * Ability to establish work flows, manage multiple projects, and meet necessary deadlines. * Advanced knowledge of communication layer between client, network and Oracle/SQL Server databases. * Advanced knowledge of and demonstrated competency in all facets of Oracle and/or SQL Server database administration. WORKING CONDITIONS: Work is performed mainly in an office environment with minimal hazards. May be exposed to temperatures, which may be cooler than a normal office setting. Travel may be required. The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimum education, experience, skills, knowledge and ability levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity is valued and we will not tolerate discrimination or harassment in any form. Candidates for the position stated above are hired on an "at will" basis. Nothing herein is intended to create a contract.  Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Database Administrator

details:
Database Administrator/AnalystMorgan Hill, CAFULL-TIME/PERMANENT ROLE90-100k/yr salaryKelly IT Resources is working directly with a prestigious and hugely successful client, a specialty retail sports retail chain that has an immediate need for a Financial Applications Database Administrator/Analyst at their headquarters’ site, in Morgan Hill, CA, (Just 20 min from San Jose!)This will be a full-time/perm role—so you would get that solid/competitive comp, benefits, bonus, annual increase and access to a plethora of other amazing perks and benefits offered to you IMMEDIATELY UPON HIRE!  Financial Applications DBA/Analyst Summary:Our client is currently looking for an experienced Financial Applications Database Administrator/Analyst to support their Global Finance Team and take responsibility for the configuration, support, maintenance and governance of their robust, and exciting Finance and Accounting systems. Global Finance provides solutions and systems in support to their FP&A, Accounting, as well as the Senior Leadership and Operations Teams worldwide, across 30 markets!!This Financial Applications/Database Administrator role offers an opportunity to be an integral IT subject matter expert and tasked with administering their Host Analytics and supporting the Finance and Accounting teams as they continue grow and scale. You will be the administrator and data owner for the Host Analytics platform as well as advanced finance analytics in Tableau!!Financial Applications DBA/Analyst Responsibilities:• Application Administrator for Host Analytics and Oracle. The designated system owner and support all integration points with financial data.• Host responsibilities include maintaining and update metadata, managing hierarchies, maintaining reporting sets, monitoring data loads for both TB and subledger, managing currency and exception rates, assigning user access and security, providing standard financial reports and assistance developing new reports in Host.• Oracle responsibilities include add and editing segments, maintaining valid code combinations, cross validation rules, manage and schedule TB and subledger loads out of Oracle.     • Provide financial application support including analyzing, designing, developing, testing, troubleshooting, implementing, and providing enhancements within current systems to ensure the current budgeting, forecasting and consolidations solution adapts to evolving business needs• Support Finance & Accounting users during Month Close and Budget/Forecast to load data, monitor system performance, and work closely with IT and Finance to troubleshoot and resolve systems issues• Manage system updates and coordinate with the business for testing and validation• Provide financial data modeling assistance in Tableau• Implement and manage Finance helpdesk ticketing system in Jira Service DeskFinancial Applications Database Administrator/Analyst Requirements:• Bachelor’s Degree in Finance/Accounting, Computer Science, MIS, Engineering or related discipline• 3+ years of experience as a Systems Analyst/Administrator or Power User• Experience working with Oracle GL 11i or 12c• Experience Cloud-based applications; Experience with MS Server, and data security• Desire to learn new technology• Challenge the status quo• Must be a self-starter, able to work independently, as well as work in a collaborative and fast paced environment• Strong analytical skills and business acumen• Ability to work cross functionally with teammates of all levels, across an organization• Proven track record of success in prior rolesFinancial Applications Database Administrator/Analyst Preferred Qualifications:• Experience with Host Analytics and Tableau is strongly preferred• Exposure to middleware, database analytical functions, aggregate functions• Desire to learn programming skills• Prior experience with migration or new implementation of new tools is a plus• Intellectually curious

details:
G.W. LISK in partnership with Remedy Technical and Professional Recruiting is looking to recruit a IT Support Technician for our Information Technology group to be located at our main facility in Clifton Springs NY.  GW Lisk is a leading global supplier of custom solenoids, solenoid valves, LVDT’s, and flame arrestors for commercial, automotive, aerospace, oil and gas and military organizations. GW Lisk is highly vertically integrated, with manufacturing capability supporting low volume, high mix to extremely high volume product offerings.  This growing business has over 500,000 sq ft of manufacturing space located in Clifton Springs, NY along with locations in Ireland and China.  Competitive compensation, job stability, growth potential, training, Profit Sharing Bonus, Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP), 401-K and company sponsored insurance packages are all part of the excellent benefits extended to Lisk employees.  
 
Position:  Database Administrator – Direct Hire 
Location:  Clifton Springs 
Citizenship:  Company is ITAR compliant American Citizenship or Permanent Green Card Status is required.  Visas are NOT eligible 
Salary:  Confidential base salary + Bonus, profit share and excellent benefits 
Travel:  Occasional international travel will be required approximately 2-3 times a year for system implementations and upgrades.  
Relocation:  Yes 
Education: Bachelor’s degree in IT or related field strongly preferred 
Experience:  5 years minimum experience working as a database administrator responsible for the critical functioning of the database as well as system implementations and upgrades.  
 
 Responsibilities:   

Works in the administration of all activities related to the administration of computerized databases including:

o   The design, creation and maintenance of the database in a client/server environment. 
o   Quality control and auditing of databases in a client/server environment to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data
o   The design and implementation system personalization’s
o   Lead and oversee all database administration maintenance and testing tasks including back-up, failover testing and sandboxing 
o   Applies knowledge and experience with database technologies, development methodologies, and front-end/back-end programming languages. Performs database programming and supports systems design. 
o   Includes maintenance of database dictionaries, overall monitoring of standards and procedures, file design and storage, and integration of systems through database design.

Work cross functionally with the organization to ensure enterprise wide functionality 
Develop and modify new and existing reports using SSRS, access, java script, cold fusion, etc.
Assists in the provision of end-user training and support for ERP modules and forms
Work with IT staff to integrate new systems/applications into Infor ERP system
Perform related duties as required or assigned
Actively participate in the continuous improvement and support of the IT Department
Perform special projects for IT Director as requested
Proven track record of success leading teams of database administrators and working as a team member: understanding personal and team roles; contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members; proactively seeking guidance, clarification and feedback; and providing guidance, clarification and feedback to less experienced team members.

 

 Requirements 

A minimum of 5 years’ experience in database administration, preferably in a global organization.  Must have strong communications skills for interacting with all levels within the organization. Comfortable working closely with IT staff in the design and optimization of data, transformation, and control of data attributes and objects that span enterprise applications. 
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems or related discipline 
Advanced proficiency in the design, implementation, maintenance and troubleshooting of databases including experience with and knowledge of fail over testing, sandboxing, disaster recovery solutions required 
Advanced proficiency in writing SQL queries, Access, Visual Basic, HTML
Communicate effectively across the organization, having a strong customer centric orientation (both internally and externally) with self-driven results attitude, and experience working with other cultures or cultural/transnational sensitivity
Be willing to travel to other facilities located in Europe and Asia as needed (% of travel will vary with projects and software implementation in these locations) approximately 2-3 trips per year 
Infor Syteline software experience is Preferred

About Unisys

Do you have what it takes to be mission critical?We are always looking for team members that have what it takes to be mission critical. At Unisys Federal Systems, our team supports the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.Our team members gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems.Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.Unisys is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. details:
**Great SQL DBA Role in Pensacola, FL***Military & Veteran Friendly**Job Description:
Implements and maintains smooth operation and physical design of databases
Conducts performance tuning of indexes, optimization of storage functionality, and databases in general
Reviews database design and integration of systems, provides backup recovery and makes recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements
Maintains security and integrity controls
Formulates policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management, and monitors transaction activity and utilization
May work with vendors
The SQL Server DBA will be responsible for the implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical SQL Server RDBMS systems, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications
This is a "hands-on" position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Responsibilities* Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.* Apply data modeling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations* Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.* Objects, such as stored procedures, functions, views, indexes, and triggers
Indexing database tables
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities.
Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members
When performance issues arise, determine the most effective way to increase performance including hardware purchases, server configuration changes, or index/query changes
Using Profiler traces and other tools to find the most frequently run queries
Requirements
MS SQL Server 2008/2012 experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools
Knowledge of HP, Sun, Dell, Intel Platforms
Write and optimize T-SQL statements
Clearance Requirement: Secret to start work
Required Baseline Certs: IAT Level II (CCNA-Security or GICSP or GSEC or Security + ce or SSCP)Nice to have skills

DoD Information Assurance experience is a plus specifically in the areas of IAVA and STIG
IT Ticketing System, such as ITSM or Serena
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment
MCTS, MCITP, and/or MVP certifications a plus

details:
Fifth Third Bank is one of the top-performing banks in the country, with a heritage that spans more than 150 years. We've staked our claim on looking at things differently to making banking a Fifth Third Better. This applies to our relationships with customers and employees alike.We employ about 18,000 people, and what we offer is:# A chance for employees to build their future, with supportive career development and financial wellness programs. # An environment where we win together. We celebrate achievement and work collaboratively. We're also a three-time Gallup Great Workplace honoree.# An invitation to impact lives in a positive and lasting way. Everything we do is geared toward improving lives. That's fun and exciting. It comes down to the fact that Fifth Third is a warm and caring place to with which to grow # as a customer or as a team member.Information Technology's vision is to be recognized as an industry-leading services company by efficiently delivering solutions and services our customers can rely on. We strive to create a business-focused team that drives significant value for the Company while building customer-centric service delivery models through the integration of technologies, data, and processes. Our customers' trust is earned through the effective delivery of resilient, secure products and services while balancing business needs with industry and regulatory requirements. Fifth Third Information Technology is comprised of several areas including: Commercial IT, Consumer IT, Payments IT, Infrastructure IT, Enterprise and Corporate Applications as well as IT Security and Risk.GENERAL FUNCTION:This is a Lead DB2 DBA (DB2 Mainframe) position, responsible for supporting the organization's DB2z databases and ensuring their performance, availability, and security. The Lead is viewed as an expert in the administration and support of database technology. The candidate is expected to communicate common goals and direction for the team and also provide superior technical leadership.DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:- Responsible for database design, development and administration of large scale Operational, OLTP andanalytical data structures including logical and physical design- Provide SQL performance tuning on both OLTP and Data warehouse environments- Optimize DB2 resource utilization by tuning queries, recommending indexes, and configuring database parameters-Provide data migration support-Provide trend analysis to management team to enable them to make informed decisions regarding resource management-Lead, mentor and/or provide guidance to less experienced database analysts where applicable including guidance for troubleshooting escalated issues-Partner with offshore DBA resources and thoroughly document processes to ensure successful implementation by offshore staff and Production Control-Provide on call rotational 24/7 Incident Response to database alerts from production monitoring tools and Command Center personnel-Analyze Key Performance Metrics and make recommendations for improvements-Provide input on the selection and implementation of all database administration tools-Maintain the integrity of data within the production environment including the execution of proper backup and restoration policies and procedures which provide point-in-time restore capabilities (disaster recovery)-Enhance site monitoring to improve availability and performance-Perform database capacity planning and trend analysis -Deploy database changes in strict accordance with change management policies and procedures-Interact and coordinate work with System Administrators, Project Managers and fellow team members to support various project requestsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:-None

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:-Bachelor's degree in CS/MIS or equivalent experience-Minimum of 6 years of heavy DB2z database administration experience and production support-Requiring DB2z V11 experience-Not required but prefer DB2 V11 or V10 database certification-Experience working with very large database partitioning-Experience working with large systems in data sharing sysplex environment-Preferred experience in data modeling with Star Schema and *Operational Data Store* concepts-Experience with evaluating and consolidating database workloads to maximize hardware resources-Experience working with IBM Admin tool suite, Query Monitor, and Omegamon (DB2 PE)-In-depth knowledge of DB2 utilities such as LOAD, UNLOAD, RUNSTAT, REORG, COPY, COPYTOCOPY, MERGECOPY, MODIFY and SPUFI.-Working knowledge of IDAA-Solid understanding of DB2 client tools such as DB2 Connect and Visual Explain-Hands on experience with performance tuning of complex SQLs-Experience with DB2 Stored Procedures (SQL and COBOL)-Prefer experience with IBM Optim Move for DB2-Prefer experience with Erwin or RDA data modeling tools-Prefer that the candidate has worked in an onshore/offshore model-Candidate must have excellent communication skillsFifth Third Bank is proud to have an engaged and inclusive culture and to promote and ensure equal employment opportunity in all employment decisions regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military status, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

details:
ECS Federal, LLC (ECS) is seeking a Database Administrator (DBA) to support an existing customer in the sustainment and enhancement of a USN data environment in Dahlgren, VA.Position Summary: The Database Administrator (DBA) administers, maintains and utilizes policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of multiple Oracle DB 12c implementation and administration. The DBA will be a member of 20+ member team that provides full-life cycle software development, system maintenance, and support to a USMC enterprise-wide system.Position Description:
Monitoring database and ensuring operational state with minimum downtime
Monitoring database for speed and accessibility and identifying potential issues that would make the database unstable or unavailable
Optimizing data queries and data loading by monitoring table space usage and adjusting table spaces
Implementing modifications to the database, as required, by monitoring and reviewing error reports to enhance the operational speed of the database (Modify existing data schemas and table, data loading into new or existing tables)
Create/Modify/Delete user accounts and apply privileges and monitor and adjust security configurations
Backup/restore data/tables/schema from the database, backup entire database, backup server operating system/state; Performing RMAN database backups and recovery
Data restoration
Monitor/implement security for database software/OS such as vulnerability patches, as well as anti-virus software and definitions
Required Skills:
Active Top Secret clearance
CompTIA Security + certification
Bachelor's degree
Three(3) years of experience with Unix/Linux administration
Five(5) years of experience with Oracle Database
Oracle Database 12c Administration
Oracle SOA Suite 12c Implementation
Deep understanding of the Oracle database, related utilities and tools
A good understanding of the underlying operating system
A good knowledge of the physical database design
Ability to perform both Oracle and operating system performance tuning and monitoring
Knowledge of ALL Oracle backup and recovery scenarios
A good knowledge of Oracle security management
A good knowledge of how Oracle acquires and manages resources
A good knowledge Oracle data integrity
Experience in code migration, database change management and data management through the various stages of the development life cycle
A sound knowledge of both database and system performance tuning
Good communication skills with management, development teams, systems administrators, and clients
Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines
Experience working in the DoD environment
Oracle DBA certification
Minimum Security + certified

details:
Job Description

GDIT is seeking Database Administrators for an upcoming program!Responsibilities include:
Provides all activities related to the administration of computerized databases. 
Projects long-range requirements for database administration and design in conjunction with other managers in the information systems function. 
Designs, creates, and maintains databases in a client/server environment. 
Conducts quality control and auditing of databases in a client/server environment to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data.

Education

Bachelors Degree in a Computer Science or related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience.

Qualifications


5+ years progressive experience of database query languages such as Oracle, PL SQL, SQL Server, and MS Acces; including 3+ years hands-on experience and expertise in Relational Database Management Systems. Experience also shall include capability to work on various operating systems and additional programming languages. 
Experience in at least two projects in a large organization responsible for administering, operating, maintaining, and securing a large-scale computer database.

title: Database Administrator

details:
Electronic Payment Exchange (EPX), a subsidiary of North American Bancard, LLC, is looking for a Database Administrator (DBA) to join the team in Tempe, Arizona.  You will be responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, maintenance and patching of database systems for both our PostgreSQL and MS SQL Server environments. This role also must be experienced with these tasks on the Oracle platform in order to serve as a secondary resource for that environment. This person participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within the database systems. The DBA ensures that databases and related systems comply with internal and external standards and security requirements.  What you will be doing: 
Maintain Production, Development, and Test databases
Ensure availability of the databases in accordance with our service level agreements
Ensure recoverability of the databases in accordance with our set guidelines
Repair problems in the databases quickly and correctly
Monitor the databases' performance and tune them as necessary verifying the integrity and availability of all resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups.
Provide Database Analysis & Design service to developers and other support groups
Offer assistance to developers in designing and tuning database queries and procedures
Research and recommend innovative and automated approaches for system administration tasks.
Regularly update and maintain operational, configuration, or other procedures and documentation.
Perform periodic performance reporting to support capacity planning.
Make rapid, well-informed, independent judgments in support of NAB's business-critical systems
Participate in on-call escalation rotations for 24x7x365 support; evening, overnight, and weekend, holiday and on-call work may be required.
Other tasks as assigned by management
  What we need from you: 
Bachelor's degree in information technology/computer science or engineering and/or a combination of education and recent, relevant experience.
Minimum of 5 years in medium-size Enterprise environment
Solid knowledge of MS SQL and MySQL, with the ability to transfer this knowledge to other team members
Experience with Oracle11g
Supporting a RDBMS on both Windows and Linux environments
Experience with troubleshooting problems and forming a resolution with IT systems and individuals
Ability to interact with a variety of clients in a clear, concise, professional manner
Solid understanding and working knowledge of complete systems development and deployment lifecycle and of all facets of systems administration in a large scale IT operations unit
Able to make effective decisions in high-pressure situations, with limited management escalation
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
PostgreSQL Database Platform and Pentaho experience preferred
Experience with Linux administration and scripting a plus
Microsoft MCDBA and/or Oracle Certifications a plus
#LI-KH1  Pay Grade: 31I

title: Database Administrator

details:
The Senior Database Administrator I is responsible for supporting multiple critical databases, some with high availability demands.  This role will be responsible for database implementation, performance tuning, ongoing monitoring and maintenance, backup/recovery, security, auditing, production support, migration and verification of the integrity and availability of all hardware, server resources, systems, and key processes.  This position will also independently troubleshoot and resolve problems of diverse scope.  ACCOUNTABILITY: The Senior Database Administrator I is accountable for the day-to-day support and maintenance of Premier’s Oracle and SQL Server database environments supporting applications such as Oracle Clinical, Deltek, Sharepoint and other in house applications.  This role is also accountable for design and architecture of new or enhanced database environments, planning for future business needs and ensuring proper validation and documentation of all database environments.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Design, implement and manage database environments critical to business processing Configure, monitor and manage database backup, tuning, patching, and disaster recovery architecture and plans Design, support and maintain high availability environments including replication, clustering, and mirroring Support all areas of the enterprise, ensuring all databases run at optimal performance Proactively identify and troubleshoot database performance issues Help establish and enforce database architecture and security standards Ensure that industry-wide best practices and standards are properly implemented Design and maintain automated application migration processes which provide High Availability and SDLC migration for Test, Pre-Production, and Production application servers Independently develop, maintain and troubleshoot complex database procedures Understand written business requirements and translate them into technical design Respond to business requests in a professional manner and with high sense of urgency Coordinate and help lead disaster recovery testing processes Lead database related aspects of any related application upgrades Understand database product licensing models and monitor usage for ongoing compliance Develop and maintain clear and accurate documentation of database architecture and related applications Evaluate, implement and manage ongoing activities to ensure database health and prevent issues Analyze database performance, capacity, and capacity planning for future database expansion to support business requirements Evaluate, make recommendations and manage uptake of database environment patching and new versions, working with stakeholders to plan and execute such updates Proactively identify areas of needed improvement in the database environments and develop and execute against plans for achieving necessary changes Collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure environments are set up to accommodate both current and future requirements Provide support to application programmers through analysis, recommendations and data refreshes as requested for database access and performance problems Maintain documentation of backup and recovery procedures of the physical data storage and logical data design for assigned databases Mentors and coaches junior staff, as applicable Other activities as designated   EDUCATION, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:   Educational Background    Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience    Experience   BS degree and 5-8 years of technology application experience, 4 of which involving database administration; or 7+ years administering Oracle and SQL Server database environments in an enterprise setting Experience in Database Administration of complex systems using Oracle 11/12c and MS SQL Server in a Windows server environment Proficiency developing and maintaining complex scripts using SQL, T-SQL, PL/SQL  and/or Powershell Strong experience with database optimization, performance tuning, backup and restore, table space allocation/management, clustering, managing the overall health and status of the database, managing the database schema, creating triggers and stored procedures, configuring and monitoring logging and resolving database-related issues Experience with evaluation, selection, implementation and management of products supporting DR and HA architecture Excellent technical troubleshooting skills   Experience with Oracle RAC and/or DataGuard preferred Experience with validation of regulated database environments preferred Experience with administration on Unix/Linux platform a plus Familiarity with web services and RESTful Services (JSON and XML) or Java/.NET a plus     Expertise and know-how    Oracle 12.x and MS SQL Server 2012+ administration and tuning Strong SQL or PL/SQL development skills Deep understanding of and experience with database administration on a Windows platform    
Personal skills & behaviours
   Fluent verbal and written English Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision Excellent team player;  collaborative; consensus builder Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities Strong verbal and written communication skills Excellent organizational and time-management skills, able to prioritize work to meet deadlines Strong desire to learn new skills and expand technical experience Accountable, dependable and strong commitment Customer service focused in approach to work both internally and externally  Maintains a positive, results orientated work environment
title: Database Administrator

details:
Every day, the people of TSYS® and Netspend® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services.  We are "People-Centered Payments", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere — and for yourself — we may have the right place for you.The Database Administration team is part of the netSpend IT operations and is responsible for administration and management of all databases (oracle, sql server etc).The Oracle DBA role will include, but not limited to design, implementation, and problem analysis and improve operation efficiencies of the oracle database technologies. This individual will share responsibility with the team for overall database support in various database environments.  The individual should be well versed in oracle database administration which includes installation, performance tuning and troubleshooting.Responsibilities:
Responsible for the installation, configuration, troubleshooting, support and maintenance of all database systems including Production, QA, and Development server environments.
Monitoring and optimization of database performance, security, resource utilization, memory configuration, sessions, archive logs, and disk space usage.
Share support for mission-critical database instances, including responsibility for after hours on-call support for issue resolution.
Leverage Oracle expertise and knowledge by providing SQL, PL/SQL, and data expertise to developers and users.
The candidate will be expected to identify opportunities for improving system quality and implementing more efficient processes and management of databases.
Participate in DBA team on-call pager rotation and on-call support duties.
Qualifications:
6+ years of oracle DBA experience on mid to large scale database environments.
2+ years of experience administrating Oracle RAC Environments.
Experience in Oracle Streams or Oracle GoldenGate preferable.
Experience in Oracle 11gR2 preferable.
Proficiency in writing shell s and sql scripts.
Strong knowledge of UNIX/Linux.
Experience in setting up Oracle DataGuard Standby technologies.
Strong knowledge of RDBMS architecture, SQL tuning, PL/SQL troubleshooting.
Good interpersonal skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal) skills.
A good team player, flexible, share knowledge and help others.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other technology field or equivalent experience.
As provided in NetSpend's Background Check policy, eligible candidates may be subject to drug, criminal history, and credit checks, which will be conducted and used in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal laws

title: Database Administrator

details:
The ideal candidate will assume the role of Database Administrator and be integral to the planning, direction and execution of our organization’s database architecture to support and enhance the data needs of our business.  Candidate should be able to perform maintenance tasks on the current environment while also looking toward enhancements for scalability and the overall growth of the business. This is a “hands-on” position requiring solid T-SQL Developer skills. SSRS/SSIS experience is a big plus. 
 
Essential Roles and Responsibilities
§  Manage SQL Server databases through development, testing, and mission-critical production environments.
§  Configure, monitor, and maintain servers and server processes for optimal system health and performance.
§  Document and apply data modelling techniques to ensure consistency in development and implementation efforts, while meeting DB performance expectations.
§  Analyze, track, refine, and resolve issues in real-time, providing end-to-end troubleshooting.
§  Provide technical mentorship and cross-training to other team members, while assisting in query writing, stored procedures, triggers and user defined functions.
§  Design and develop best-practices for queries and stored procedures with best practices for use by other team members.
§  Some off-hours/flex support will be expected in this role for system maintenance and monitoring activities.

Required Qualifications
§  BS Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field.
§  3+ years MS SQL Server administration experience within an enterprise environment with emphasis on 2 and 3 tier architectures, server versions 2008 R2 thru 2016.
§  3+ years Windows Server experience, including utilization of Active Directory and Windows best practices and concepts.
§  Advanced knowledge and experience in T-SQL coding: query writing, stored procedures, triggers and user defined functions.
§  Experience with performance tuning and optimization, native monitoring and troubleshooting tools, and backup/restoration/recovery models.
§  Experience with SSIS packages and SSRS reporting tool.
§  Thorough understanding of security, high availability, disaster recovery, replication/mirroring, failover clustering, and log shipping best practices.
§  Ability to contribute to project planning, scope, and versioning dialogues and documentation.
§  Strong verbal and written communication skills.
 
Preferred Experience
§  Previous experience within the healthcare industry.
§  Experience working within a highly integrated team comprised of both technical and non-technical members.
§  Experience working independently on projects and tasks with minimal instruction.
§  Solid understanding of industry standard fundamentals including data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis.
§  Deep rooted desire to contribute to constantly adapting techniques, technologies, and concepts.

title: Database Administrator

details:
Our team is what makes Octo great. At Octo you'll work beside some of the smartest and most accomplished staff you'll find in your career.  Octo offers fantastic benefits and an amazing workplace culture where you will feel valued while you perform mission-critical work for our government.  Voted one of the region’s best places to work multiple times, Octo is an employer of choice!

Octo Consulting Group is seeking a Database Administrator to join our growing team in Washington, DC on an exciting and vibrant Federal Government role.  This is literally the infrastructure on a worldwide outreach program and the work you do will matter in how the US is viewed around the world.

Our DBA will Manage, monitor and maintain MySQL and Oracle databases and related components on on-premise hosted infrastructure as well as on AWS RDS.  Your main focus will be on 24/7 uptime and support of COTS products using these databases.

Responsibilities Include:


Maintaining Oracle RDBMS (Oracle 12C) and MySQL in an enterprise environment

Analyzing complex problems that impact the project and provide innovative solutions/options for improving performance

Analyzing database requirements within an object-relational database system, such as ORACLE RDBMS, of assigned projects. 

Analyze and determine information needs and elements, database relationships and attributes, proposed manipulation, data flow and storage requirements, and data output and reporting capabilities.

Develop new database design and modifications; applying knowledge of database management systems to coordinate maintenance and changes to databases;

Testing and implementing changes or new database designs; writing logical and physical database descriptions, including location, space, access method, and security requirements.

Provide direction to programmers and analysts as required to affect changes to database management systems. Provide answers to database questions. 

Monitor databases and analyze/organize data and apply new technology designs and programs

Monitor and tune all databases for optimal performance

Work closely with all WordPress team members to debug performance-related problems and identify performance bottlenecks

Proactively make recommendations and follow through to keep Databases secure, up to date, and functional for intended user groups




Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of experience with database design, installation, and support.

Familiarity with Jira, Jenkins, GitHub.

Experience working on most phases of applications programming activities, independent of supervisory guidance.

Experience with database development and administration requirements.

Understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in Database Development, Administration and Performance related disciplines.

Experience with Web Services, and SOA

Experience with projects delivering website and application solutions for US Government clients strongly desired.

At least 8 years of post-collegiate professional experience

Primary or secondary degree in Computer Science/Information Systems or related field

Working knowledge of AWS


Desired Skills


Familiarity with Agile management concepts.

At least 1 years of experience in Content Management System (WordPress)

At least 1 years of experience with AWS.


Physical Requirements:


Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of the time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc.

Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbs.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of time


Work Environment:


Individual’s primary workstation is located in an office area

The noise level in this environment is low to moderate


At Octo, our focus is on delivering results that matter. We are a premier provider of digital solutions and services to the federal government specifically in the areas of UI/UX, Agile, Data, and Cloud services.  We support and modernize our federal customer’s mission critical systems and functions. Agility is at our core: it is the mantra that drives us to succeed. We work quickly, analytically and deliver on agency priorities.

Octo is a growth-oriented firm that provides a unique, differentiated employee culture relative to our Federal market peers.  We leverage this growth-oriented and employee-focused culture to attract and retain a higher grade of talent than our peers to be an employer of choice. 

http://www.octoconsulting.com/careers



Please no Corp-to-Corp or 1099 candidates; this position is W-2 only

We are unable to sponsor H1B applicants for this role

US citizenship required as per potential clearance requirements

Relocation will not be offered

Octo Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, protected veteran status, race, color, religious creed, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation/gender identity, age, or genetic information. Octo Consulting Group’s commitment to diversity and inclusive selection practices includes ensuring qualified long-term unemployed job seekers receive equal consideration for employment

title: Database Administrator

details:
With all the opportunities out there, what’s the best way to raise your game and up your impact? Put yourself on a team that’s doing incredible things with data to create incredible health care solutions across the globe. That’s no small thing. In fact it’s all about big data and big ideas.  Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, has more technology, greater data resources and far broader expertise than any competitor anywhere. As an IT Database Specialist, you’ll work with state-of-the-art relational database technologies and be part of a team that’s developing mission critical applications and systems. You’ll be responsible for the design, implementation, support and maintenance of all functions of relational database systems.  As you do, you’ll be helping to make the world a smarter, healthier place. Primary Responsibilities
Partner with project teams and interact with customers to find solutions for projects and operational issues for existing and proposed databases 
Design storage strategies around backup and recovery for complex database environments, physical structures and specialized database applications/systems 
Act as a liaison serving as primary point of contact between application business segments and database administrators 
Identify and initiate resolutions to user problems and concerns associated with database server equipment (hardware and software) 
Know that this opportunity comes with big potential and big challenges. It’s a fast paced team that includes some of the top minds and most intensely focused technology professionals in the business. You’ll be expected to work cross functionally bringing smart ideas and solutions through design, implementation, support and maintenance
We are a company that is on the rise. We're expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about transforming the health care industry. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience 
5+ years of experience as an Oracle DBA 
5+ years of experience with RAC and performance tuning

This is where the best and the brightest work together to make positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)

details: Are you an experienced Database Administrator III? If so, let’s talk! Our client is actively seeking a talented Database Administrator III to work at their location in Kansas City, Missouri. This is a Temp to Perm assignment. Key Responsibilities:  Provides and applies technical strategies in the designing, implementing, administering, maintaining and performance tuning database systems and related technologies. Provides technical consultation for enterprise and application project teams. Participate with members to identify and clarify strategy, address gaps, define and execute related policy/procedures and pursue improvement opportunities. This position is expected to work independently with minimal guidance and assistance with the technology supported. Day to day support and maintenance of assigned databases, including: Ensuring recoverability via backups or other solutions Ensuring high availability for business users Maintaining a strong security profile with patching, updates and audit logs Administering and documenting user accounts and maintaining authentication controls Monitoring capacity and growth and licenses Day to day customer service for assigned databases, including: Assisting users and resolving problems Proactively reviewing and researching for problems Assisting application teams in resolving performance problems Support of projects, including: Routine support tasks as assigned Design assistance and consulting including identification and documentation of design concerns related to performance, security, auditability, availability and recoverability Management of test and other non-production databases for the projects   Performance, capacity, recovery and other testing  Requirements:  Golden Gate and Exadata experience are plus. This is a temp-to-perm role Understands and considers standard concepts, best practices and procedures related to database development and administration. Working knowledge of multiple database applications, programming languages and/or system environments. Working knowledge of business goals, corporate IT standards, strategy and service level agreements. Communicates effectively with all levels of employees, both technical and non-technical. Establishes cooperative relationships with departments. Effective project team member, at times assuming leadership role for the project. Searches for and identifies alternative and/or innovative solutions to technical problems. Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget. Exercises sound judgment when making decisions. Quickly adapts to multiple demands and rapidly changing priorities. details: Administrator, Database II WOW is currently seeking for a mid-to-senior level Database Administrator to implement and to support our data warehouse and internal applications. This person will be responsible for the implementation, monitoring, maintenance and control of the database environment -- including SQL Server, Postgres Snowflake and Redshift technologies. The DBA will work closely with all functional groups to assure a smooth implementation and compliance with all corporate adopted industry standards, directions and best practices. This position will also be responsible for providing support to technical/business processes that database technologies for monitoring, maintenance, backup/recovery, data movement/conversion, and reporting concepts. This individual will also be responsible for collaborative work efforts with various Information Management/IT teams to deliver timely and effective solutions that correspond with WOW's enterprise architecture direction.  Duties and Responsibilities:  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following but are not limited to:  Install, upgrade, maintain, monitor and document all production and non-production data warehouse and application development environments Capacity planning Performance tuning Replication Work closely with development teams Perform DML to production database as necessary Perform code reviews, performance monitoring and tuning Promote releases from lower environments through production Enforce WOW policies and procedures surrounding data management, security and storage. Assist in keeping policies up-to-date and developing new policies Ensure and enforce all database schemas are tracked through source control and process Design, test and implement backup/restore and disaster recovery procedures Capability to prioritize according to needs of the business Provide 24X7 support on a rotation schedule Coordinate closely with architects and technology leads from other technology areas, while virtually leveraging subject matter experts from any needed technical or business area Collaborate with members of the business, project teams and IT staff as needed to fulfill the responsibilities described above  Qualifications:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education:  Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments Project solution architecture experience   Experience/Skills Needed:  5-7 Years of Experience in a corporate environment 4+ years' experience and knowledge of RDBMS production environments including monitoring, maintenance, tuning, performance, and capacity management 2+ years' experience and knowledge of SQL Server production environments including monitoring, maintenance, tuning, performance, and capacity management Demonstrated ability to work well with others Track record for remaining unbiased toward any specific technology or vendor, and for being more interested in results than personal preferences Track record for thinking about more than technology issues, and for integrating the technical with the business and information aspects for complete solutions Capability for being thoughtful, extroverted and collaborative Motivation that is focused on long-term results Applicant to be focused, goal driven, and possess an obsessive attention to detail Applicant must be a team player who can motivate as well as provide coaching as needed Must be able to work under pressure, along with demonstrating solid time management skills and demonstrate a winning attitude   Working Conditions/Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  regularly required to talk and hear required to use hands to type, handle objects and paperwork required to reach and hold on to items at chest level or reach above the shoulder required to use close vision and be able to focus travel to other offices may be required on an occasional basis   WOW! is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employer

title: Database Administrator

details:
SKILLS ID SUMMARY


Role:      Data Warehouse Administrator 
Location:    Phoenixville, PA

Role Summary:
At Customers Bank, we believe in working hard, working smart, working together to deliver memorable customer experiences, and having fun. Our vision, mission, and values guide us along our path to achieve excellence. Passion, attitude, creativity, integrity, alignment, and execution are cornerstones of our behaviors. They define who we are as an organization and as individuals. Everyone is encouraged to have personal development plans. By doing so, our team members are on their way to achieve their highest potential and be successful in their personal and professional lives.
Customers Bank, recently named by Forbes magazine as the 35th Best Bank in America (there are over 5,700 banks in the United States!), has an immediate opening for a Data Warehouse Administrator within our Business Technology department. As a Data Warehouse Administrator, you will provide intermediate to advanced technical skills and leadership in the design, development, control, and use of business data. This role is accountable for the full cycle of design, coding, testing, data quality, and documentation of the company’s data warehouse. This individual is responsible for the integrity, security, and processing of business data and files, and works with business stakeholders to translate requirements into technical specifications.
We are looking for a highly motivated, analytical thinker, who thrives in a fast-paced environment. 

Responsibilities:

●  Coordinate with business analysts and prepare design for systems
●  Manage all architectural issues and recommend alternatives to same
●  Maintain all required documentation for data warehouse
●  Evaluate efficient working of project team and provide guidance on process methodology
●  Develop and maintain standards for data warehouse and ETL
●  Ensure compliance to all specifications and documentation of all data warehouse administration activities
●  Monitor ETL jobs and databases and ensure optimal performance
●  Manage and collect business metadata
●  Schedule plans for all tasks and maintain an effective database
●  Manage all data integration points
●  Other duties as assigned





Qualifications:

●  Bachelor of Science in Information Systems or related major/work experience
●  5+ years of business technology experience, preferably in banking or financial services industry; or appropriate combination of education and experience
●  Relational and dimensional data modeling
●  Intermediate level Oracle database administration
●  Linux Server
●  Oracle RDBMS 11g or higher
●  Oracle PL/SQL
●  ETL (extract, transform, load) development
●  Microsoft Visual BASIC for Applications (VBA)
●  ANSI SQL
●  Oracle Warehouse Builder or Oracle Data Integrator
●  Oracle SQL Developer
●  Oracle SQL Developer Data Modeler
●  QlikView Server
●  QlikView Desktop
●  Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, Visio
●  Analytical and problem-solving skills
●  Attention to detail
●  Customer service orientation
●  Attracted to complex technical challenges

Technology Strengths:

●  Database design
●  Software development
●  Database administration
●  Systems integration
●  Networking

Travel Requirements:

Requires 3% travel. Occasional travel within Northeast may be required and potential trips outside the area for training several times a year.


Customers Bank will provide consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex/ gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.
