title: Database Administrator

details:
We are looking for an Oracle Goldengate Replication and RAC specialist to work as a Lead Oracle Database Administrator, who will be working in a senior capacity as part of a team of DBAs. Working in collaboration with cross-functional teams to design, build, upgrade, modify and operationally administer new or existing Oracle databases in support of critical enterprise applications.  
Responsibilities
 

Acts as a database technology subject matter expert (Primary Focus Goldengate and RAC), providing technical leadership within the DBA team. Working with cross functional teams in building, scalable enterprise solutions.
Designs, configures and manages complex Goldengate mappings, to facilitate change data capture and integration between various transactional and analytic systems.
Establish and maintain performance baselines, troubleshoot performance issues and provide recommendations/fixes for identified issues. 
Provides architectural guidelines to build and maintain scalable database environments. 
Creates, supports and administers relational databases.
Oversees administration and performs hands-on administration of databases, related tools, processes and operations in large OLTP,  batch and data warehouse environments.
Recommends solutions that require definition of the physical structure and functional capabilities of databases and required data security and data backup/recovery specifications.
Ensures proper design, implementation, performance, availability, security, auditing and capacity management of related database systems.
Develops and implements standards and best practices
Operates under general direction. Assignments are very broad in nature and of the highest level of complexity. Able to impact beyond area of responsibility.


Knowledge/Skills and Experience
 
Must have prior experience in and deep knowledge of the following:

Must have strong Oracle administration, database architecture skills
Must have excellent Goldengate administration skills (Version 12c) 
Well versed in setting up and administering multi-node RAC clusters hosting multi-terabyte databases.
Oracle Security and Hardening expertise is required.
Practical experience in pro-active and reactive database performance tuning. 
Database capacity forecasting
Supporting large scale Oracle databases on unix based systems, preferably Linux and AIX
Databases hosted on virtualized platforms (AIX LPARs, VMware)
Extensive experience with different backup/restore and disaster recovery solutions
Recent experience installing, configuring and managing Oracle v11.2 to v12.2 environments.

 
Desirable skills include:

Unix shell scripting, perl scripting skills are highly desirable.
Infrastructure Automation skills highly desired.
Experience administering Netezza is highly desirable. (NPS 7 or higher)
Experience with Puppet Labs or Chef tools desirable
SQL Server Database Administration skills are desired
Healthcare experience is highly desirable.

 
Other requirements
 

Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate technical concepts in an easy to understand form is essential.
Should be a team player, with excellent organizational skills. Should have a positive attitude and be willing to bring A game to the table every day 
Operates under general direction. Assignments are very broad in nature and of the highest level of complexity. Ability to influence and have impact beyond own area of responsibility. 
May instruct, guide and oversee work of lower-level technical professionals. 
Consults and makes recommendations to management on significant issues. 
Responsible for developing and implementing new products and/or approaches in conjunction with implementing new/existing technologies.
Knowledge encompasses entire scope of a technical discipline and has received recognition for development of one or more unique sub-specialties. 
Experience working in a team which delivers a highly available environment supporting large project development efforts 24 x 7 onshore and offshore is desired. Familiarity with SDLC, Data Modeling, ITIL concepts and practices is required. 
Participation in On-Call Rotation is required

 
Educational/Experience Requirements

Generally requires 8 to 12 years of directly related professional experience and possesses deep technical abilities in one or more primary products, programs or technologies.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or specialized training, certification or equivalent work experience.

details:
As a leading worldwide provider of navigation devices and wearable technology, our focus is on developing, designing and supporting superior products. Our advanced technology promotes performance, safety and ease of use in every market we serve. That makes us an engineering and technology company with a keen focus on recruiting talent in those fields. But the same vertical integration business model that keeps all design and manufacturing processes in-house also gives us the incentive to hire top performers from different backgrounds, including operations, finance and accounting, information technology, sales, marketing and communications.   We entrust our IT department with our two most important clients: our customers and our global business community. They take their mission to deploy relevant, reliable and secure technology solutions seriously. They like to push the limits of their technical expertise. It's a challenging way to work, but our success depends on it We are seeking a full-time DBA/Data Engineer at our headquarters' in Olathe, Kansas.  In this role, you will be part of a talented team whose mission is to provide technical expertise and performant data solutions to ensure the integrity, availability and security of Garmin’s data. The responsibility of each Data Engineers includes coming up with new innovative solutions as well as keeping existing solutions highly available and reliable. Other essential functions include:
Learn new data technologies and practices
Identify and resolve problems proactively
Analyze existing data solutions and recommend improvements
Thoroughly document work in an organized manner
Communicate in written and verbal form effectively
Perform administrative tasks by following defined procedures
Develop new data solutions including brand new database system.
Provide 24x7 on call support
 The technologies worked on include mySQL, SqlServer, Oracle, Cassandra, Gemfire, Elasticsearch, HDP, PostGres, Kafka.

Qualified candidates will possess a Bachelors' Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, Business, or another technology related field.Other qualifications include:
Experience and/or training with Java and Java Database Connectivity (JDBC)
Experience with no-sql solutions such as Cassandra, Mongo, Gemfire
Experience with Big Data solutions
Experience with any relational database system, such as (but not limited to) MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, or PostgreSQL
Advanced Windows or Linux Administration skills
Experience and/or training with Oracle database High availability (RAC/ASM/Dataguard)
Must be detail-oriented and have the ability to work proactively and effectively with minimal supervision
Ability to prioritize and multi-task independently in a flexible, fast paced and challenging environment
Demonstrated ability to learn basic technical concepts independently
   Our benefits are designed to lead an evolving marketplace, support innovation and encourage a healthy balance between work and life. They allow our associates to make their own decisions about their wellbeing and future and consistently rank Garmin as a top tier benefits provider when compared to other high-tech employers. We offer a choice of high value medical, dental and vision plans with low or no premiums, to fit your and your family’s preferences. In addition, Garmin’s financial benefits include a generous 401K retirement plan that provides 5% of pay base contribution plus a match of 75 cents for every dollar you contribute to a maximum of 10% of your compensation. The employee stock purchase plan allows for shares to be bought at a 15% discount. Garmin offers many other benefits and perks ranging from wellbeing initiatives, educational assistance and career development, community charity support, and employee discounts just to name a few. design, develop, modify and generate specific reports upon request; create tables, queries, and forms; and provide hard copies as requested• Ensure the quality, accuracy, and consistency of all database entries• Create and maintain documentation or users’ guides for each database and train designated personnel on use of databases, as needed• Assist in the integration/connectivity of multiple Oracle based databases operating at multiple independent levels of security• Provide technical guidanceExperience:• 7 - 9 years related experienceEducation:• Bachelor’s degree in a related area or equivalent experience (4 years)Certifications:• Must meet position and certification requirements outlined in DoD Directive 8570.01-M for Information Assurance Technician Level 2 within 6 months of the date of hire.Security Clearance: • Current Top Secret Clearance with SCI Eligibility• Eligibility for access to Special Access Program Information• Willingness to submit to a Counterintelligence polygraphOther Requirements:• Proficient in Microsoft Access Databases and a working knowledge of Oracle• Ability to work in a dynamic environment and effectively interact with numerous DOD, military/civilian personnel and industry partners• Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)• Possess a high degree of originality, creativity, initiative requiring minimal supervision• Must be familiar with security policy/manuals and the appropriate DCIDs/JAFANs and other guiding policy documents• Requires travel within the organizational geographic Area of Responsibility (AOR) (note - could be extensive, and will include both air and ground transportation)• Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.

A Bachelor degree or equivalent in a related field and seven to nine years of relevant work experience are required.
title: Database Administrator

details:
Overview   Dignity Health, one of the nation"s largest health care systems, is a 22-state network of more than 9,000 physicians, 63,000 employees, and 400 care centers, including hospitals, urgent and occupational care, imaging and surgery centers, home health, and primary care clinics. Headquartered in San Francisco, Dignity Health is dedicated to providing compassionate, high-quality, and affordable patient-centered care with special attention to the poor and underserved. In FY17, Dignity Health provided $2.6 billion in charity care, community benefit, and unpaid cost of government programs. For more information, please visit our website at www.dignityhealth.org . You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook .  Responsibilities  Position Summary:    Database Administrators (DBA) work closely with architects, infrastructure support, systems engineers, project managers and application support teams to ensure seamless and quality IT support for Dignity Health customers and alignment with Dignity Health"s IT standards, controls and governance.  To be successful at this level, individuals must possess a combination of technical, business and communication skills. This position requires a solid understanding of IT infrastructure, database related applications and general computer operations, combined with significant related practical IT experience.  In addition, this position requires having the ability to acquire a solid understanding of the business and technical needs of the organization. This includes learning and following the required business processes and technical skills that are essential to being successful in this position.  Individuals working in this job family must possess strong communication skills, combined with basic negotiating skills. This includes the ability to work with diverse groups and individuals at multiple levels within the IT organization and throughout Dignity Health.   Responsibilities:    Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator:  
 Performs daily monitoring and support activities on all assigned SQL Instances, including but not limited to: database backups and restores, general users requests (simple to moderately complex), disk space management, SQL Instance (single and multiple) installations and SQL server patching. 
 Participates in the SQL DBA Team on-call rotation and is able to independently resolve SEV4 & SEV3 Incidents, and up to SEV2 Incidents with limited assistance. Exercises good judgment when escalating SEV2 or SEV1 Incidents to DBA III and/or DBA IV. When on-call, participates in the resolution of SEV2 & SEV1 Incidents. 
 Acts as principle DBA for minor projects. Participates in major projects associated with the enhancement, upgrade or implementation of new or existing technology solutions, as assigned. 
 Exercises independent judgment to solve simple to moderately complex problems. Seeks assistance from senior team members as needed to resolve complex problems. 
 Follows SQL DBA Team standard practices and methods to conduct basic to moderately complex troubleshooting to resolve performance issues for assigned SQL Instances as needed. Utilizes additional tools and techniques to determine root cause of issues. 
 Utilizes T-SQL and existing PowerShell scripts to automate routine tasks and to assist the team with managing the environment. Takes initiative to develop new scripts to improve the teams overall ability to "manage more with less". 
 Demonstrates solid understanding of programming with Microsoft T-SQL, including but not limited to; all data types, primary & foreign keys, indexing, tables, views, stored procedures, triggers, DBCC commands and DMVs. 
 Follows best practices as defined by the SQL DBA Team. Actively participates in the review and implementation of best practices as part of the team. 
 Works primarily with the SQL Database Engine, SQL Query Analyzer and SQL Profiler (or equivalent). Takes initiative to gain required skills to work with Reporting Services and Integration Services. 
 Understands current (personal) Microsoft SQL database administration skills and is committed to learning, acquiring and improving Microsoft SQL database administration skills at multiple levels. 
 Demonstrates integrity and understands the importance of data security and the role of the Database Administrator with respect to implementing Dignity Health security and compliance policies. Understands how to implement and enforce a "least permissions model" for all SQL Instances managed by the SQL DBA Team 
 Adheres to the Dignity Health IT Change Management processes and protocols when initiating or participating in all change management requests. Takes initiative to make sure that the SQL DBA Team is involved in database Change Requests. 
 Under the direction of the Team Lead, initiates opportunities to learn and work with all components of the Microsoft SQL Server Database Platform. 
 Works with Enterprise IT Operations, Application Support Teams, and Project Managers as required to assist with the resolution of technical issues. Will assume a leadership role when needed to resolve issues. 
 Provides exceptional customer service to Dignity Health end users, business stakeholders and other members of Dignity Health IT. 
 Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications: 
 BA or BS in Computer Science, Technology, or Business discipline or equivalent experience is required 
 3 to 5 years (or more) of professional experience working within a small to moderately large IT organization providing day to day operational support as a Microsoft SQL Database Administrator (DBA). OR 5 to 7 years (or more) of professional experience in one or more of these database related technologies: Data Analytics (SSAS), Reporting (SSRS) and/or ETL (SSIS) Development, Database Design, or in a Senior level Role providing Application Support of multiple applications (medium complexity and broad in scope) requiring a solid understanding of the Microsoft SQL Database Platform. 
 1 to 2 years (or more) of professional experience working as part of a defined group of technical individuals. 
 Technical: 
 Demonstrates a solid understanding of concepts and key terminology related to working with server hardware, database server requirements, multiple versions of Windows Operating Systems, and multiple Storage Technologies (RAID levels, NetApp & EMC). 
 Demonstrates a solid understanding of the daily operational and performance monitoring tasks related to supporting existing and new SQL Server environments. This includes being able to customize operational and performance monitoring tasks for simple to moderately complex database applications. 
 Demonstrates a solid understanding of the data security responsibilities of a DBA and understands and can apply a "least permissions" database security policy in standard environments with minimal supervision. 
 Demonstrates a solid understanding of, and experience with, relational database environments. This includes demonstrating a solid understanding how applications connect to and interact with database environments. In addition, understands can articulate the basic differences between an OLTP vs. OLAP database environments. 
 Demonstrates a strong interest in expanding scope of responsibilities as a database administrator and takes initiative to work with SSRS and SSIS (administration, implementation and basic design). 
 Demonstrates strong independent learning skills to improve existing technical skills and is self-motivated to acquire new skills. Is willing to assist other team members as needed to learn new skills. 
 Productivity and Communication: 
 Demonstrates the ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Follows standard policies and protocols. Is able to handle multiple tasks, shows good judgment when managing and prioritizing competing requests, and works to consistently meet commitments in a fast paced and complex work environment. 
 Demonstrates a solid knowledge of the essential software applications used throughout the organization and specifically by the DBA Team. Assists other DBA Team members as needed in the use of these applications to increase the DBA Team efficiency. This includes, but is not limited to; Asset Management, Incident & Request Management, Project Management and Change Management. 
 Demonstrates a willingness to take initiative to resolve issues and differences between individuals and groups to achieve a common goal. Understands when critical issues need to be escalated to SQL Team Lead, Management or IT Infrastructure Leadership. 
 Demonstrates strong customer service skills and is committed to a customer-centric approach to service delivery. Is able to communicate effectively with customers, both within the organization and with vendors outside of the organization. 
 Demonstrates the ability to successfully interact with individuals and teams at all levels of the Dignity Health organization. In addition, must be able to work with Dignity Health Leadership to meet goals and objectives. 
 Demonstrates respect for and follows all IT Operational and Infrastructure processes as defined by the organization, including assisting other team members as needed. 
 Preferred Qualifications: 
 Experience in the Healthcare Industry. 
 3 to 5 years (or more) of professional experience in an IT technical, infrastructure or complex application support. Experience should include working with database platforms, utilizing basic scripting methods (e.g. PowerShell), understanding general server related performance problems (e.g. memory management, disk I/O), assessing capacity requirements and root cause analysis. 
 5 years (or more) of professional experience demonstrating an increasing level of responsibility, managing a moderate to large workload, making positive contributions related to workflow / work processes and interacting with multiple levels within the IT organization. 
 Microsoft Certifications associated with Microsoft SQL Server Database Technologies (relevant only if for the current version or one previous version).
title: Database Administrator

details:
Job Description The Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for ensuring the integrity of all the databases within the operating unit. The DBA maintains the internal database of ALIS as well as the individual applications. The DBA works closely with the System Administrator to carry out and sustain system-wide backups and restores. The DBA will provide maintenance of databases to include the following: backups, disaster recovery, database support (status checks, Oracle critical patch updates). Also, this candidate will serve as the point of contact to for the F-35 Squadron discussion during the flight and evaluation activities.DBA DutiesDBA Duties include the following:
Performing data transfers between operating units and other systems (internal and external)
Providing user access to data
Maintaining server operational status
Configuring assets to support user needs
General backups, restore, updates
Troubleshooting assets
Monitor test progress and corrective actions
Hardware/software baseline status
Typical Education & Experience Bachelor's Degree and 5 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education  Security RequirementsCandidates must hold an active Secret security clearance, last Periodic Reinvestigation must be within the last five years.Candidates must be able to attain and maintain Special Access Program (SAP) access and must able to obtain and retain Security+ certification Basic QualificationsThe ideal candidate will have experience in the following areas:
Systems & software engineering
Database administration process background
Database Development experience
Familiar with COTS/developed Software (Oracle, SQL and/or Siebel
Must be willing to work off hours, to include 0300-1200, 0700-1600 or 1000-1900, and/or 1500-2400 depending on operational needs
Must be willing to travel, to include Squadron deployments for extended periods depending on operational needs
 Preferred Skills and Education The ideal candidate will have the following skills:
Demonstrated database administration skills, to include:
Experience with importing large data volumes and managing large Oracle and SQLServer databases, be able to execute and troubleshoot database SQL scripts and report/correct finding and issues to the development team.
Database backups for Disaster Recovery preparation and maintenance on the Oracle databases. Scripts to perform Level 0 and delta (Level 1) backups, full logical export of all database data that collects snapshots of parameter files and checks database for logical and physical corruption.
Database restoration for disaster recovery from most current backups.
Status check scripts to troubleshoot database issues by pulling status of every database on the server, status of the database listener, and provide database system file tampering notification.
Manually install Oracle Critical Patch Updates.
Reviewing V$ tables and DBA views for any issues that may arise.
Locate user session data via the command line.
Performance tuning utilizing SQL commands (without using Oracle Enterprise Manager).
Oracle Recovery Manager (RMAN) experience for backup and recovery to include hot and cold backups.
Understanding of SQL/PL-SQL language and be able to execute.


Demonstrated system administration skills, to include:
Setting up configuring and troubleshooting all aspects that make up Storage Area Network (SAN) Fabric architecture (Zoning, logical unit number (LUN) Masking, and host bus adapter (HBA) Hardware.
Setting up configuring and troubleshooting all aspects that make up Internet Protocol (IP) Switch Fabric architecture (Routing, Fail Over, etc), Working knowledge of Networked Attached Storage (NAS) and supported protocols.
Engineering skills required for maintaining Enterprise Server Racks.
Strong Working knowledge of SSL/VPN security architecture with integration into multi-layered Firewall architecture.
Ability to work with EMC storage configuration tools (Navisphere, Visual SAN, Fabric Manager).
Performing System Virtual Volume Imaging and Recovery, Disk to Disk/DR and Disk to Tape.


Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to create presentation material for management and customers
About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That’s BAE Systems. That’s Inspired Work. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression. To see Inspired Work in action, visit www.baesystems.com and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/baesystemsintel.

details:
Every day, the people of TSYS® and Netspend® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services.  We are "People-Centered Payments", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere — and for yourself — we may have the right place for you.NetSpend is seeking an Apache Cassandra DBA to oversee the database administration functions of Apache Cassandra. This position is responsible for database planning, design implementation, as well as the maintenance and optimization of Apache Cassandra.The Apache Cassandra DBA will be part of the DBA team, NetSpend IT Operations.  The DBA team manages and supports all database administration functions for Oracle, SQL Server and Apache Cassandra.Responsibilities:
Install/Configure/Maintain/Tune and Administer of Apache Cassandra of Datastax Enterprise Versions.
Setting up Multi-Datacenters for Cassandra.
Implement Disaster Recovery for Cassandra.
Patch/Upgrade Cassandra.
Implement, maintain and tune Apache Spark.
Implement backup strategies for Apache Cassandra.
Participate in DBA team on-call pager rotation and on-call support duties.
Implement monitoring solutions.
Work with Development teams on Cassandra Data Modeling.
Experience/Qualifications:
2 years of Cassandra DBA experience.
1 year of Oracle DBA experience preferred.
Proficient with all Cassandra utilities (nodetool, cqlsh etc)
Experience in Disaster Recovery Planning and Implementation.
Must be able to patch/upgrade Apache Cassandra.
Experience in performance tuning Apache Cassandra.
Experience in Planning and implementing (scripting) backup strategies for Cassandra.
Experience with Apache Spark in Production Environments required.
Strong knowledge in UNIX/Linux Environments.
Expert in scripting languages like bash and Perl.
Experience with administrating Oracle Databases is strongly preferred.
Experience in Cassandra Data Modeling.
Good interpersonal skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal) skills.
A good team player, flexible, share knowledge and help others.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other technology field or equivalent experience.
As provided in NetSpend’s Background Check policy, eligible candidates may be subject to drug, criminal history, and credit checks, which will be conducted and used in accordance with applicable local, state and federal laws.

title: Database Administrator
Database Administrator

details:
Reporting to the Manager of Information Technology, the Database Coordinator primarily designs, implements, administers, maintains and evaluates the Walters Art  Museum’s databases and provides the primary desktop and software-related technical support for problem resolution. When needed, the Database Coordinator provides technical support to the Head of Imaging and Intellectual Property with regard to ResourceSpace (data asset management system) and to the Assistant Registrar for Data and Images with regard to TMS (the collection management system). The Database Coordinator provides consistent backup support to the Information Technology Manager with server administration, user account maintenance, system documentation, help-desk support functions and participates in planning of future upgrades and technology enhancements.

 


Oversees user accounts/groups, recommends and manages security permissions and develops and implements related security policies in partnership with the Information Technology Manager.
Assists staff in identifying and producing their reporting and querying needs including the creation and revision of specified custom Crystal and SSRS reports and the identification of data entry requirements for staff that are necessary to create reports.

Implements, maintains, and troubleshoots database system integrations. 

Implements and maintains test environments for database systems where new processes and upgrades can be tested. Maintains the test environments with recent production data.

Develops and maintains comprehensive disaster recovery and backup plans for database systems and data. Monitors these processes to ensure appropriate coverage. 

Creates and maintains user guides, manuals and documentation for system administration, data entry and data retrieval.
Performs end-user client maintenance as related to database applications, including installation and troubleshooting.
Trains staff in database usage and provides end-users with daily support for all database related issues as help desk resource.
Conducts file transfers, imports, exports and dissemination of data and associated media to web based applications and partner organizations.
Uses security protocols, database administration protocols, table and metadata management to ensure data integrity, digital preservation of resources and a successful end user experience.
Keep database applications running in optimum condition by evaluating new version upgrades for all databases and testing and applying upgrades as needed. Maintains database application test environments to safely facilitate both this process and all database processes and development initiatives.
Anticipates future client and server hardware needs for database applications by developing growth scenarios and end-user needs requirements, and works closely with the Manager of Information technology on budgeting and planning to meet those needs.
Extends the functionality of applications by developing and maintaining SQL scripts, stored procedures, automated reporting, PHP utilities and other applications that facilitate imaging and information workflows, data sharing, interoperability and data integrity.
Works with end-users to define needs for customized application interfaces, data views and other user-interface components. Use vendor-provided tools to implement customizations or serve as the technical lead for developing larger-scale, outsourced customizations. 
Automates digital preservation and metadata schema protocols to as great extent as possible by using scripts, utilities and stored procedures.
Interacts with all necessary departments/divisions to analyze and gather report requirements for generating criteria and output.
Provides back-up support to the Information Technology Manager in supporting the network and infrastructure of the museum.

Qualifications include BA in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related field, three years of experience with various database applications and strong SQL scripting skills, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.  Experience with Crystal reports, SSRS Reporting and MySQL preferred. Must have good organizational skills, be detail oriented, and communicate effectively.  




 
 Salary is commensurate with experience. We offer an attractive benefits package. For consideration, send your resume, cover letter with salary requirement to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]. Application end date is April 30, 2018. 
  
An Equal Opportunity, Equal Access Employer
A smoke and drug free workplace

details:
Apex Systems has a long-term contract (12 Months, with potential to hire) opening for a Sr. SQL Server DBA with a large financial client in the Tampa/St. Petersburg, FL area.  Main responsibility will be to spearhead solutions for widespread issues, while also researching solutions to reoccurring problems and assisting the DBA team with specific project work.  Client is seeking an individual with Strong Core SQL DBA Skills (version 2008/2012/2014), the ability to write and tune complicated Stored Procedures (T-SQL), and experience troubleshooting and supporting SSIS packages.
The detailed job description is provided below.  If interested, please email your up to date resume to Aaron Gibbs, Senior Professional Recruiter, via [Click Here to Email Your Resumé].  If you wish to receive job alerts from Apex that match your criteria please join our Talent Network/Job Portal via https://itcareers.apexsystemsinc.com.
Job Description (SQL Server, DBA):
Positions Responsibilities/Project Details:
Part of a team of 2. Main function will be when widespread issues occur; the incident manager will hold a call with the appropriate SMEs to get the issue resolved. This person will serve as the SQL DBA SME. When things are quiet and there are no issues, this person will research how to fix reoccurring issues and maybe some specific project work from the DBA team. They currently have multiple versions of SQL. Core applications are all proprietary. Mostly .Net, some Java.
Position Requirements:

Minimum four years Microsoft SQL Server 2008/2012/2014 DBA experience.
Good Transact SQL skills – ability to write and tune complicated stored procedures and views utilizing inner and outer joins, etc.
Experience with supporting and troubleshooting SSIS packages
Experience in writing stored procedures and views
Performance tuning
3- 5 years client server experience with emphasis on SQL programming
Good customer service, interpersonal and communication skills

Preferred Skills:

General knowledge of Windows 2008/2012 and hardware
Experience with Windows Power Shell 
Experience supporting and troubleshooting SQL data replication using GoldenGate

title: Database Administrator

details:
Assists in the design, implementation, and maintenance of SQL server Integration Services and SQL Server Analysis Projects.  Work on several phases of ETL and Database Development such as creating and maintaining Databases, Stored Procedures and the ETL Process that populate those Databases.    Specific Duties/Accountabilities:          Responsible for the day-to-day duties ETL and Database Development,         ETL Design and Development         Supporting Daily Jobs Containing ETL Packages        Server and database level security           Population and Refresh of Databases        Back-up and recovery         Review and optimize the views, stored procedures, indices and scripts         Create and automate the monitoring functionality in SQL to identify problems and provide proactive solutions.           Integrate and support data requirements from new and existing applications.         Maintain, update and debug the various reporting applications        Create custom reports as needed.  PERFORMANCE MEASURES:         •        Successful completion of daily updates •        Increase ETL and Data Refresh Efficiencies •        Accurately plan for future ETL and Database needs   

Knowledge: 
Possesses a university degree/college diploma in applied technologies and/or 5+ years systems analysis and programming experience with extensive business knowledge 
Possesses solid knowledge of design and analysis methodology and application development processes from both an industry and BMO perspective 
Demonstrates solid understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Quality Assurance requirements and software development control and release procedures 
Applicant should be proficient in the following languages & tools:  Java, J2EE, SQL, PLSQL, UNIX (shell scripting), Oracle, MQ, ClearCase, Eclipse, Toad. 
Skills:
Possesses solid analytical skills for complex problem solving 
Is able to manage multiple priorities 
Is able adapt and quickly develop in-depth technical understanding of new/different applications 
Is detail oriented with strong organizational skills 
Demonstrates solid communication skills, both written and verbal 
Demonstrates good leadership skills and independence
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: •        Bachelor’s degree in MIS or Computer Science preferred •        Strong working knowledge of SSIS and job creation combined with experience in physical and logical database design. •        Knowledge of banking or finance industry preferred  We’re here to help At BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank. As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset. To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers.com. BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO Harris Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer for all, inclusive of Minorities, Women, Veterans, and Persons with Disabilities.

details: DB2 LUW Database Administrator – Solution Specialist- USDCAre you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology – a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel?  If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center – we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon.  Interested? Read more about our opportunity below … Work you’ll do/Responsibilities ü  Solid understanding of RDBMS concepts and DB2 LUW databaseü  Experience in DB2 LUW instance and database creation on Linux/ Unix and Windows environmentü  Experience in Linux/ Unix shell scripting, shell command, crontab and vi editorü  Database objects creation, DB object migration and data conversionü  Knowledge on DB2 partitioning and Federation setup is a plusü  Experience in Logical and Physical Data Modelingü  Strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask; can set priorities and follow a timeline. Ready to work on flexible work scheduleü  Deep knowledge of SQL and PL/SQLü  Knowledge of query performance tuningü  Strong communication skills, both written and oralThe Team From our centers, we work with Deloitte consultants to design, develop and build solutions to help clients reimagine, reshape and rewire the competitive fabric of entire industries.  Our centers house a multitude of specialists, ranging from systems designers, architects and integrators, to creative digital experts, to cyber risk and human capital professionals. All work together on diverse projects from advanced preconfigured solutions and methodologies, to brand-building and campaign management.  We are a unique blend of skills and experiences, yet we underline the value of each individual, providing customized career paths, fostering innovation and knowledge development with a focus on quality.  The US Delivery Center supports a collaborative team culture where we work and live close to home with limited travel. QualificationsRequiredü  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experienceü  Ability to adapt quickly to an existing, complex environmentü  Ability to quickly learn new concepts and software if necessaryü  Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player and exhibit exceptional relationship management skillsü  Ability to multi-task & support multiple priorities / multiple deliverablesü  Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills How you’ll growAt Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world.  From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career. BenefitsAt Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.  Deloitte’s cultureOur positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.   Corporate citizenshipDeloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities.  We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities.  Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world. Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.

title: Database Administrator

details:
Tuknik Government Services is seeking a Senior Database Administrator to work with our Federal client in the Albuquerque, NM area.This is a direct, full time position supporting TGS and our government client.We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, 11 paid holidays, 3 weeks paid time off, and more.This position will be part of a team supporting a Federal Client in managing a large scale financial system conversion/integration project, by providing project management, change management and technical advisory services.Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to: 
Develop, update and maintain ETL specifications and documentation used to develop data migration mappings and transformations for data warehouse loading
Troubleshoot ETL issues as they arise by evaluating the ETL packages as well as the data stored in the source SQL and flat files
Work with business requirements to identify, understand, and analyze source data systems
Expertise in extraction, Transformation and Loading (ETL) to achieve data integration between various source and destination systems
Adapt ETL processes to accommodate changes in source systems and new business user requirements
Provide support and maintenance on ETL processes and documentation
Strong SQL Server experience, with recommended Oracle experience
Possess experience in maintaining and developing stored procedures, triggers, queries, job scripts, and functions. Database maintenance experience should include projects that considered scalability, compatibility of applications, cost reduction, and optimization of indexes and queries for the purpose of analyzing large datasets for business needs.
Have advanced knowledge of the migration of raw data, schemas, tables, indexes, and table constraints.
Extensive experience in ETL process and utilization of ETL tools for migration purposes
Obtain direction and guidance from the Director of MSA, ACIO and or DACIO;
Gather, extract, manipulate, analyze and model data using analytical and statistical tools in support of the migration efforts as identified within MSA;
May also be required to provide database maintenance and development in support of the Program migration;
Ensure data accuracy and create ad hoc reports to support the Program migration; and
Perform other senior database administrator actions as assigned.


Requirements
BS degree in Computer Science, MIS, or similar
5+ years of SQL Server experience
5-10 years of DBA experience
Expert Knowledge in SQL
Ability to work well within a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines
Experience with Federal consulting or implementation of financial systems preferred
Excellent customer service attitude, communication skills (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills, along with skills in dealing with a diverse population.
Working Environment & ConditionsThis position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to manipulate, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The work load may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, perform simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress. The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required for the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.Our Equal Employment Opportunity PolicyThe company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment.The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require an accommodation to navigate or to apply to a position on our website, please contact Heaven Wood via e-mail at [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodations.

title: Database Administrator

details:
Responsible for assisting in designing, planning and implementing databases, including security, access and documentation.  Provides technical assistance in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures as they relate to databases.PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Demonstrates a relentless commitment to meeting and exceeding customers’ expectations while also achieving the goal of reducing the risks and costs of providing services. Works to build an effective partnership with the internal customer on a daily basis.  Listens to customers and asks the appropriate questions to determine their requirements.   Collaborates with other parts of the organization as required to first share and analyze customer requirements and then develop and implement the best strategy and processes to meet those requirements. Performs intermediate level troubleshooting of host systems and middleware databases. Performs intermediate troubleshooting of network devices related to database connectivity. Assists in developing database best practices related to performance, capacity and archiving. Monitors and/or troubleshoots automated database functions by utilizing tools for verification of services, monitoring tool set availability and detecting, reporting, escalating, tracking and documenting anomalies. Maintains database documentation (database libraries, best practices and performance and capacity metrics). Defines and develops a maintenance strategy and maintenance scripts relating to backup and recoveries of databases. Analyzes database performance statistics and performs required tuning activities to optimize database performance. Adheres to service level agreements by following established SLA performance requirements
 Adheres to IT best practices by following established IT best practice performance Adheres to Incident Management process and performs assigned incident identification, notification, documentation, and intermediate level diagnosis and remediation activities.  Adheres to Change Management process and performs assigned change activities including monitoring and tracking change activities.  Participates, documents and oversees network maintenance activities to ensure activities are completed with SLA requirements. Adheres to Release Management process and performs assigned database release actions.  Assists engineers in planning efforts associated with projects and releases.
 Adheres to Audit Management process and procedures and performs assigned actions to capture audit evidence criteria. Participates in individual professional development by completing assigned development plan, participating in mentoring activities, tracking and reporting of development, and communicating career path goals and objectives. Provides training, mentoring, and coaching to junior Database Administrators through free flow of information, encouraging and appropriately evaluating feedback, encouraging innovation, and inspiring / motivating others. Assists with the delegation of tasks to junior Database Administrators, oversees workflow of department, and effectively communicates changes that affect employees’ work with limited supervision. Contributes to the performance feedback for junior Database Administrators.	  
SCOPE  Complexity: Functions Responsible for or InfluencedModerate – influence on database structure and administration Diversity: Locations Responsible for or Influenced                       Moderate – collaborates with individuals from a variety of sites Typical Job Problems and Difficulties            Client operational issues, database performance issues, after hours support requirements Financial Accountability            Medium – Mistakes could lead to costly penalties, downtime, etc…MANAGEMENT Job Reports to (direct)            Technology Manager Job Reports to (indirect)            Operations Manager Direct Reports to Job            None Authority for Staff Managed            None Indirect Reports (influenced)            None Level of Complexity for managing/organizing staffGENERAL Extent decisions governed by procedures or referred up            Moderate – some but not all actions dictated by policy / procedure or must be escalated to management for resolution Standard requirements for research and analysis            Frequent – new product research and analysis Opportunity and consequence of typical errors (supervision)                   Frequent with moderate / high impact – errors on work performed on daily basis could lead to costly penalties and service interruptions Frequency and complexity of internal business contacts            Frequent with moderate complexity – deals with clients on semi-complex  issues on a daily basis Frequency and complexity of external business contacts            Infrequent with low impact – deals with vendors occasionally Physical (% time: travel, operating machinery, environmental etc.)Minimal physical requirements – low travel, no special environmental issues. Shared on-call responsibilities in a 24X7X365 environment.EDUCATION Minimum education            Bachelor's degree with a technical major or equivalent experience.  Database certifications are preferred Years experience2 to 4 years of related experience with degree Minimum technical knowledge and skills - Required Comprehensive knowledge of Office suite and PC operating systems Advanced ability to navigate through Unix/Linux/AIX/VMS/DOS and execute commands Intermediate level knowledge of Windows, LINUX, AIX and VMS configurations and functions Advanced ability to use OS utilities Intermediate level knowledge of Sybase, DB2, MySQL and SQL databases Intermediate level ability to update, modify, reconfigure, backup and restore databases Intermediate level ability to create, modify, test, implement and maintain database scripts (DCL, LSE, Perl, SQL, SQR, VI, etc) Intermediate level ability to use of database analysis tools (Dbartisan, Enterprise Manager, etc……) Basic knowledge of change and incident management tools Intermediate level ability to detect, analyze, troubleshoot and escalate database incidents Intermediate level ability to forecast, recommend, and implement capacity planning Intermediate level knowledge of industry and local audit requirements Advanced knowledge of IP protocol and LAN topology	  Essential special training requirements 
 ITIL foundation training and certification Basic level – gateway access servers Basic level - IGT lottery system applications, processing, transaction life cycle, GUI applications and monitoring tools Basic level - IGT and local logical security policies and procedures and log review process Basic level - external contractual customer requirements Basic level - operational entry/exit criteria	  Other skills – Required 
 Demonstrates strong performance leadership skills including the ability to coach/mentor, deliver training, inspire and motive others, objectively assess the performance of others and provide balanced feedback Demonstrates the ability to lead the work of others effectively, including leading change and delegating work. Exhibits professional and customer appropriate communications (written and verbal).  Listens effectively and demonstrates empathy and understanding of others’ concerns.  Demonstrates knowledge of techniques needed, and experience in dealing with difficult or demanding customers Displays strong technical writing skills and presents information in a professional and engaging manner.  Promotes teamwork and cooperation and builds strong relationships at all levels.  Effectively collaborates and negotiates. Organizes and plans work effectively.  Balances priorities among stakeholders Effectively resolves complex issues by reviewing and analyzing relation information, diagnosing, evaluating  options and implementing solutions. Exhibits sound business judgment and exhibits common sense Identifies opportunities to implement new or modified approaches to resolve problems and maximize opportunities Completes work in a thorough, accurate, well thought out, and timely manner and with attention to detail Demonstrates high degree of ethics, integrity and confidentiality at all times. Displays initiative and self-motivation.  Sets high goals for self and others and demonstrates a strong sense of urgency.  Achieves results in a high pressure environment Effectively delivers training in area of expertise. Effectively implements and manages processes	  Other requirements: 
 Must be able to support 24X7X365 operations as required to include holiday and weekend work as needed
title: Database Administrator

details:
Every day, the people of TSYS® and Netspend® improve lives and businesses around the globe through payments. We make it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions including credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services.  We are "People-Centered Payments", and our team has the unique opportunity to help create a world in which payments make people's lives easier and better. This is both a tremendous honor and an important responsibility for those who accept the challenge. If you are looking to make a valuable difference for people everywhere — and for yourself — we may have the right place for you.Summary of This RolePlans computerized databases, including base definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, operational guidelines and protection. Ensures accuracy and completeness of data in master files and various support tools, such as base dictionaries. Establishes and maintains security and integrity controls. Formulates and monitors policies, procedures and standards relating to database management. Proposes and implements enhancements that will improve the performance and reliability of the system.What Part Will You Play?
Performs testing of database software, utilities and fixes within a test (sandbox) environment prior to production roll out. Identifies and resolves issues while in the sandbox environment. Performs the migration of tested/approved software, utilities, and fixes to the production environment. Develops basic to moderately complex database configurations by creating database objects per specified business requirements and the necessary sandbox environments for testing. Works in close liaison with application developers to ensure best practices are applied to mitigate potential impacts to the various user groups and/or other database configurations. Coaches/mentors less experienced Database Administrators (DBAs) as they begin to perform routine/basic database administration tasks.
Schedules database back-up tasks and ensure proper completion of scheduled tasks. Execute database recovery task during a disaster recovery and/or disaster recovery exercise.
Monitors current usage levels of database storage to identify and report growth trends and assist in the forecasting of future storage requirements. Assists with the development of long-term capacity plans. Performs routine maintenance such as data compression and defragmentation (online reorg).
Ensures the high availability of the supported database(s) by actively monitoring database performance to identify bottlenecks, such as inefficient queries, inconsistent and/or corrupt indexes, database design, and provides recommendations for corrective actions. Applies routine database tuning and optimization techniques, such as rebuilding indexes, to maintain database performance. Perform database statistic reporting on a regularly scheduled basis.
Works closely with the Applications Team while performing troubleshooting to determine the source of application failures. Assists in the development of solutions to minimize the potential of future application failures. Supports the implementation of solutions.
Produces and maintains operational database documentation, such as DB2 Disaster Recovery, DB2 Recovery Presentation, Naming Standards, Performance and Tuning, to ensure database configurations are well documented in preparation for disaster recovery.
Assists in the training and familiarization of less experienced DBAs regarding company policies and procedures, techniques and current server/database configurations.

Bachelor's Degree

Installation, customization, testing, and maintenance of database systems within a production environment
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
IT related field

details:
Responsibilities:

Support Contract Lifecycle Management System (CLMS)

Provide day-to-day management of CLMS and Blue Shield systems that affect CLMS (e.g., approving new users & providers, communicating to the users about things like outages), communicating with Blue Shield IT team members about internal outages that could affect CLMS, etc.
Trouble shoot issues (working with appropriate partners to resolve CLMS system issues)

Resolve any system issues where CLMS is not working as it should (e.g., contract provision not populating, certain section of the contract not being created)
Interface with vendor and other subject-matter experts to resolve issues and manage resource dedication
Work with the CLMS user to determine the problem and possibly work with the Vendor to resolve the issue
Log and track the issues and resolution for future reference and training

Provide system oversight 

Monitor the contracting process (turnaround time)
Monitor the number of CLMS users by category
Develop new “intervention criteria” based on observation of system usage (i.e. large volume of unapproved provisions)

Develop and maintain long-term training documentation and continuous learning opportunities (webinars, communications, best-known practices, and detailed training documents that are posted on Shield Central (SharePoint platform)

Construct user adoption/experience surveys

Be a subject matter expert on CLMS system to answer questions from various users

Coordinate the enhancement process (e.g., assist in the inventorying, requirement collecting, and roll-out of system enhancements)


Work with vendor to make system/application changes


Manage CLMS defects through vendor Help Desk ticket system


Assist with ad-hoc projects and other analytic support
Assume a leadership role, serving as a consultant as to how CLMS can support the business needs
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and vendor to identify enhancement opportunities to improve data collection, integrity and efficiencies
Collect, analyze and synthesize data

Independently summarize findings and present data in formats such as Excel pivots, PowerPoint, reports, grids and tables

Create meaningful reports as needed by management

Expert in advanced development and maintenance of report requirements, including custom and standard reports that are anticipated to be needed
Provide business requirements for system reports. Ensures the report requirements meet the needs of the business


 
Key Factors for Success:

Bachelor’s degree and  relevant experience

Literacy in analytical and database management tools such as Excel (advanced); SQL; Access knowledge (link tables, run queries) 


Proficiency with Word, PowerPoint, Visio and SharePoint

Excellent interpersonal & communication skills
Ability to test, modify, compile, and execute concepts of the project
Good math, analytical and problem-solving skills
Keen attention to detail
Demonstrated project management skills
Ability to work in a team environment
Ability to work independently, proactively and with little direction

 

Education/Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or higher is preferred.   An ideal applicants will have four (4) to seven (7) years experience with BA degree, or two (2) to five (5) years with MBA degree.

details:
Apex Systems has an immediate Sr SQL/Sybase DBA role open for a high profile client in Reston, VA.
The Sr. Database Administrator provides database production support in a fast-paced operations environment supporting 24x7 business critical applications using backend MS SQL database as primary database platform and Sybase as secondary platform. Database Administrator will be responsible to provide database operations support that includes production support, deployment, upgrade and database performance tuning for enterprise servers.
Required Skills
-Provide DBA support on all aspects of Microsoft SQL Server including administration, backup/recovery, replication, deployment and real time production troubleshooting responsibilities on MS SQL Server 2008/2008R2/2012/2014 DB environments.
-Install, configure, monitor, upgrade and maintain database in production and non-production environments
-Provide 24x7 on call DBA support for production environment on rotation basis
-Provide Database deployment support for Test and Production environments
-Diagnose and address database performance issues using performance monitors and SQL profiler Interact with Windows administrators on Windows server operating systems issues related to Databases
-Deploy SSIS packages and provide basic trouble shooting support for SSIS to developers
-Maintain internal database maintenance script written in PowerShell and Batch scripts
-Configure and maintain Always-on features for Database
-High availability Support data replication using SQL replication for reporting database environments
-Troubleshoot database production problems and database connectivity issues
-Implement HA and DR solutions using Windows clustering, Always-On and SRDF/SRM solutions
-Ability to work well as a team and as an individual with minimal supervision
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Desired Skills
-Experience supporting Sybase database platform under Unix/Linux platforms
-Experience with Unix/Linux OS platform and Unix Shell/Perl scripting
-Experience with Database monitoring tools such as Foglight
-Good understanding of other Microsoft products such SSRS and SSAS
-Experience working in virtual environment using VMware Database performance tuning skills
-Database vendor certification
Basic Requirements
-More than 7 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server using 2005/2008/2012/2014
-Solid understanding of Database technology - MS SQL Server and Sybase/or any DB platform
-Solid Database performance tuning
-Deep knowledge of industry-standard, enterprise-class best practices for a large database environment
-Good understanding of windows platform and SQL 2008,2012
-Deep understanding of HA, DR Database and storage technologies like Data replication, SRDF/non-SRDF Experience with Solaris, Linux and Windows platforms

Please send resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] if you would like to be considered for this role. 
Thanks, 
Apex Systems

details:
MS-SQL Database Administrator      ClearCaptions is looking for a MS-SQL Database Administrator who is responsible to help manage our growing and complex SQL database environment, across several companies, multiple platforms, and dozens of different projects. They work fast, converse well on the phone and in person, work well with other, is experienced, detail oriented, and dependable, and has a positive, upbeat attitude.    More than 48 million Americans have some form of hearing loss. ClearCaptions service and equipment removes communication obstacles through its commitment to making lives better and adhering to the belief that every word matters.   As a Federal Communications Commission (FCC) certified telephone captioning provider, ClearCaptions follows the highest industry standards for privacy, security and professionalism on all our captioning calls. ClearCaptions is dedicated to developing fast, easy and life-changing communications for hard-of-hearing individuals.   If you’re looking for a wide-open field for real growth and opportunity, as well as making a difference in real peoples’ lives every day, look no further.     

 QUALIFIED CANDIDATES POSSESS:   •           Engineer, implement and monitor a variety of MS-SQL SQL environments   •           Design, implement, and maintain our SQL disaster-recovery policies   •           Architect appropriate DR strategies, such as log shipping, mirroring, AWS, or other technologies   •           Troubleshoot SQL server service outages and perform issues as they occur, including occasional after-hours and weekends   •           Configure SQL server monitoring utilities to minimize false alarms   •           Act as a member of our software-development team to review impacts of queries before code goes to production   •           When performance issues arise, determine the most effective way to increase performance including hardware purchases, server configuration changes, or index/query changes   •           Act as a mentor to off-shore members of our SQL DBA teams   •           Act as a SME and serve as a point of escalation and become actively involved, as required, to meet schedules and resolve problems   •           Minimum 5 years’ experience in architecting, building, and maintaining MS-SQL environments   •           Experience working across a variety of SQL -0 Server versions, including 2005, 2008, 2012, and 2016   •           Experience with clustering, replication, virtualization, and SQL load balancers   •           Experience with performance tuning and query optimization   •           Experience with disaster recovery features of SQL server, such as Windows Failover Cluster Services and Availability Groups   •           Experience with setting up and maintaining SSRS   •           Experience working in an agile environment   •           Strong knowledge of AWS a huge plus    PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Employees may experience the following physical demands for extended periods of time:   •           Sitting, standing and walking (95-100%)   •           Keyboarding (40-60%)   •           Viewing computer monitor requiring close vision (95-100%)    Disclaimer: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification.  It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees to this job.      ClearCaptions details:
Please send your updated resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] if you are interested in this position. 

Senior Database Administrator
Summary
The client is seeking an experienced leader with a passion for Database Administration, Data Analysis and Data Modeling. As Senior Database Administrator, the ideal candidate brings proven leadership experience and the ability to thrive in a highly collaborative and fast-paced work environment. The client needs a strategic and tactical leader to develop, improve and enforce best practice processes and plans, which impact both product quality and project on time delivery.  This is a hands-on, analytical and technical role, requiring strong leadership experience and comprehensive SQL Server expertise in business data analysis, design and project quality assurance, preferably with Public Pension Management or Financial Services systems background.
Responsibilities:
The Senior Database Administrator provides strong technical, analytical and presentation skills to lead, assist and mentor current staff, and actively participate in enterprise projects.  Responsible for the security, integrity, performance and availability of enterprise-wide data.  Applies best practices to administer and optimize data resources.  Serves as senior team member on the client's Database Administration team.  Consults with project teams, management and business partners on the different aspects of data management and database design, and provides DBA support accordingly.  Develops and implements data administration procedures.  This position requires comprehensive experience in database analysis and administration. The Senior Database Administrator’s responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: 

Partnering and collaborating with stakeholders in order to meet business and customer expectations for quality, scope and schedule


Responsible for enterprise-wide data security, integrity, performance and availability of Business Solutions Database Administration operations
Create, maintain and apply SQL Server database administration standards to align with SQL Server Best Practices
Manage SQL Server databases through multiple product lifecycle environments, from development to mission-critical production systems.
Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
Apply data modeling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations
Refine and automate DBA processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems.
Supporting and leading database project efforts across the agency by preparing and working with disparate teams in the delivery of business information and data needs
Overseeing the development, collection, signoff and maintenance of SDLC artifacts in support of agency business systems
Ensuring proper documentation and reporting efforts of program activities are appropriate, thorough, complete and signed off


Required Skills:

SQL Server 2012+  Database administration
Database Performance Monitoring, Tuning and Optimization
Data modeling and database design
Development of T-SQL, stored procedures, SSIS and SSRS
Knowledge of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server
Experience of working with Windows server 2012 and 2016, and Active Directory
Knowledge of SAN Storage
Ability to organize and plan work independently
Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams
Microsoft database certifications a plus


Preferred Technical skills:

OLTP and Data Warehouse environment support
SSRS and SSAS administration and development
Data scrambling (PII de-identifying) methodology or software tool usage
SQL Server Master Data Service
PowerShell, Unstructured Data and Big Data
SQL Server 2014/2016 upgrade experience
Logical and physical database modeling utilizing Erwin or similar tool


 Additional required skills

Bachelor degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field
Minimum of 8 years of SQL Server Administration experience in complex software applications.
Collaborative but decisive personal style; highly effective communicator and problem solver; team player
Experience with developing and driving systems data analysis and design processes
Must be an excellent communicator and able to produce clear and concise documentation at the detail and summary level
Must meet deadlines


Preferred

Comprehensive knowledge and experience with public or private pension management or financial systems definition, design and implementation.
Experience with Agile software development methodology
