title: Database Administrator

details:
RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Senior Oracle DBA in Saint Petersburg, Florida (FL).Essential Job Functions:
 Administers and manages complex database systems
 Creates, manages, and monitors performance and tuning of databases
 Responsible for data warehousing design, data arch strategy design and capacity planning
 Demonstrates subject matter expertise and is able to integrate domain knowledge with an understanding of financial services standards and practices
 Is the primary on the most complex or escalated issues and may provide direction and guidance team members
 Applies specialized business knowledge and technical skills to significant deliverables and projects that involve multiple IT departments, business units, and have enterprise impact; Is able to make judgements and recommendations based on the analysis and interpretation of data
 Ensures availability, security, and integrity of assigned databases
 Implements data models and database designs and enables applications with efficient back-end access and processing
 Resolves database performance, capacity, replication, and other distributed data issues
 Installs and configures database management software (DBMS) and applicable service packs and/or patches
 Develops and implements database maintenance plans, including performing integrity checks, updating statistics, and monitoring security and hardware resource utilization
 Establishes regular backups of databases and transaction logs
 Manages logins and user accounts, including assigning database object permissions and ancillary privileges
 Schedules and manages jobs for data transfers and sundry procedures and monitors performance and impact on operations
 Participates in data modeling and database logical and physical design
 Participates in app dev processes and code reviews of database objects
 Analyzes long-term database performance trends to optimize database and app performance



REQUIREMENTS:
 Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related degree 
 5 years of relevant experience including relational database programming experience or combination of education, training and experience
 Experience in Financial Services or other regulated industry preferred
 Experience with the following Oracle products and options: Oracle RDBMS Enterprise Edition, Real Application Clusters (RAC), Replication solutions such as Data Guard and Golden Gate, Exadata and other engineered systems, Multitenant, Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM)
 Experience with PL/SQL code development and tuning
 Performance tuning and analysis using AWR, ASH
 Scripting and automation using shell scripting, Perl, Python, etc.
 Capacity planning for all aspects of a database system (storage, compute, memory, etc.)
 Understanding of networking and connectivity and how it relates to a database environment
 Informed position on cloud services and options 
 Ability to occasionally work a non-standard shift including nights and/or weekends and/or have on-call responsibilities
 Exposure to ITIL principles a plus

Competencies and Behaviors:
 Analysis: Identify and understand issues, problems and opportunities; compare data from different sources to draw conclusions
 Communication: Clearly convey information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
title: Database Administrator

details:
North American Bancard is looking for a Postgres (PostgreSQL) DBA to join the team based in Troy, Michigan. For the right candidate, we could be open to a remote worker based in the Grand Rapids, Michigan area. If you are looking for a challenging position in a fast-paced environment where you make a difference every day, NAB is the place for you.  The Database Administrator - Postgres is a critical member of the IT Operations team, managing NAB's production and development databases. You will be responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, maintenance and patching of database systems, within the NAB environment.  What you will be doing: 
Maintain Production, Development, and Test databases
Ensure availability of the databases in accordance with our service level agreements
Ensure recover-ability of the databases in accordance with our set guidelines
Repair problems in the databases quickly and correctly
Monitor the databases' performance and tune them as necessary verifying the integrity and availability of all resources, systems and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups.
Provide Database Analysis & Design service to developers and other support groups
Offer assistance to developers in designing and tuning database queries and procedures
Research and recommend innovative and automated (where possible) approaches for system administration tasks
Identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale
Perform periodic performance reporting to support capacity planning.
Make rapid, well-informed, independent judgments in support of NAB's business-critical systems
Participate in on-call escalation rotations for 24x7x365 support; evening, overnight, and weekend, holiday and on-call work may be required
  What we need from you: 
Bachelor's degree in information technology/computer science or engineering field.
Minimum of 5 years experience supporting databases in a enterprise environment.
Solid knowledge of PostgreSQL 9.x, MS SQL 2012/14/16, with the ability to transfer this knowledge to other team members.
Supporting a RDBMS in both Linux and Windows environments.
Experience with troubleshooting problems and forming a resolution with IT systems and individuals.
Ability to interact with a variety of clients in a clear, concise, professional manner
Solid understanding and working knowledge of complete systems development and deployment life cycle and of all facets of systems administration in a large scale IT operations unit.
Able to make effective decisions in high-pressure situations, with limited management escalation.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
It would be a plus if you had: 
Experience in an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment- RDS, Redshift, EC2, etc.
Experience with UNIX / Linux administration
Database High Availability / Replication i.e. AlwaysOn, Postgres HA, etc.
Scripting experience (Perl, Python, PHP, BASH, etc)
AWS Certification and Oracle Certification a plus
Microsoft MCDBA a plus
At North American Bancard we celebrate diversity and create an inclusive environment for everyone, we are an equal opportunity employer.  #LI-KH1  Pay Grade: 30I

details:

Evaluate, document, implement, test, and performs incident resolution and root cause analysis on a variety of databases. Work with various software environments, operating systems, and computer hardware platforms. Follow incident, problem, and change & release management processes. Multi-task and work in cross functional team.
Assists with the implementation of new databases ensuring that standards, policies, and procedures are met or exceeded.

details:
Senior Oracle Database Administrator
Amherst, NY

Sr. Database Administrator of Database Operations, provide on call production support on the Oracle Database Management Systems, including incidents, alerts monitoring and resolution, installation and configurations of Oracle and its various components, and enforcing the M&T Bank security standards and guidelines. Report daily to management about abnormalities and critical issues; provide root cause analysis and recommendations; work with infrastructure team, application team and/or other teams for problems resolution, follow escalation path if needed. Responsible for overseeing the installation, maintenance, and support for Oracle Database Management Systems. Works with infrastructure team to install and test new versions of or patches to the Oracle Database Management Systems. Keeps abreast of new database related technology and products. Participate in and contribute to the development of policies, procedures, methodologies, standards, and guidelines pertaining to database administration including, but not limited to, system startup and shutdown, database backup and recovery, data integrity, high availability, space management strategies, and security. Assists Team Lead in providing technical guidance, scheduling of internal projects, and alert management/resolution.

Oracle - Oracle 12.1 and 12.2, Data Guard, Fast Start Failover, OEM 13c, Oracle Patching, Roles and Privileges, RMAN, some RAC exposure.   
Unix knowledge - specifically Linux and Aix
excellent problem determination/resolution skills
excellent communications skills (both verbal and written)

details: Infinity Insurance Company is a leader in bringing specialized automobile insurance programs to the marketplace.  We deliver innovative products and services that are designed to meet the diverse and evolving insurance needs of consumers. When we named our company "Infinity" we knew it was a bold title. Infinity means without end. For more than 50 years, Infinity has done justice to its name, searching for every possible way to offer the best service. The key to our ongoing success is excellence. We strive for excellence in every detail, from our policy offerings and insurance products to our hiring and training programs. We don't take excellence for granted. All of our hard work has paid off.  We consistently outperform the industry by making auto insurance more accessible, easier to understand and affordable. ABOUT THIS POSITIONMonitors, administers, and maintains company databases. Headquartered in San Francisco, Dignity Health is dedicated to providing compassionate, high-quality, and affordable patient-centered care with special attention to the poor and underserved. In FY17, Dignity Health provided $2.6 billion in charitable care and community services. For more information, please visit our website at www.dignityhealth.org . details: With sales of €40.5 billion in 2016, Continental is among the leading automotive suppliers worldwide and currently employs more than 230,000 employees in 56 countries. In the Powertrain Division we integrate innovative and efﬁcient powertrain system solutions from today and tomorrow for vehicles of all categories. Within the vision of Clean Power, our products make driving not only more affordable and environmentally friendly, but also more comfortable and enjoyable. We offer our customers a comprehensive selection of products ranging from gasoline and diesel injection systems, turbochargers, engine management and transmission control systems to sensors and actuators. Exhaust aftertreatment, fuel supply systems as well as systems and components for hybrid and electric drives complete our portfolio. There are two main impulses for the advancement of drive technologies: Firstly, active climate protection, in particular the reduction of CO2 emissions and exhaust gases. And secondly, the increasing need for individual mobility, which results in various requirements for vehicles and drive systems. The Powertrain Division has more than 35,400 employees working at 54 locations in 19 countries. title: Database Administrator

details:
Job Description

Responsible for designing, planning, implementing and administering databases, including security, access, and documentation.  1. Participates in the design, maintenance, enhancement, coding, and administration of relational databases. 2. Analyzes and determines information needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, data flow and storage requirements, and data output and reporting capabilities. 3. Coordinates new data development ensuring consistency and integration with existing data warehouse structure. 4. Reviews business requests for data and data usage, researches data sources for new and better data feeds. 5. Participates in continuous improvement efforts in enhancing performance and providing increased functionality, including performing proactive maintenance such as ensuring continued space availability, monitoring activity, and documenting problems, changes, and solutions. 6. Coordinates testing of designed applications. 7. Assignments may include design of data dictionaries, database structure and layout, installing, upgrading, and managing database applications. 8. Provides guidance and work leadership to less experienced analysts, and may have supervisory responsibilities. 9. Stay current on vendors' best security practices in relation to organizational requirements. 10. Maintains current knowledge of relevant technologies as assigned. 11. Participates in special projects as required.

Education

Bachelors Degree in a Computer Science or related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience.

Qualifications

8-10 years of related database analysis and/or administration experience. Security+ certification preferred. PL/SQL experience preferred. Experience with Oracle required.   As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors.With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services.GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Overview
Vencore is a proven provider of information solutions, engineering and analytics for the U.S. Government. With more than 40 years of experience working in the defense, civilian and intelligence communities, Vencore designs, develops and delivers high impact, mission-critical services and solutions to overcome its customers most complex problems. Headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia, Vencore employs 3,800 engineers, analysts, IT specialists and other professionals who strive to be the best at everything they do. Vencore is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

The INCEPTUM Tools team is responsible for configuring, operating, and maintaining the customer’s Systems Engineering business process tools to support processes to include configuration management, risk, issue and opportunity management, schedule management, architecture management, and requirements management. INCEPTUM provides system administrator functions for the tools. The Tools team also provides user training on systems engineering business process tools and has a large emphasis on identify opportunities to optimize systems and tool execution through automating processes, consolidating or migrating existing tools, and/or acquiring new tools.As a member of the Tools Team, the team member will be responsible for the configuration and maintenance of the database for the IBM Rationale Tool Suite application to support tools transition and integration efforts supporting the contractors' and customers' needs.  The ideal candidate will be able to function effectively with minimal oversight and be able to prioritize tasks based on customer requirements.   Additionally, the applicant should understand the importance of database integrity in terms of both efficiency and security.  Responsibilities include:  Server software installations to support the COTS products, configuration of database servers, maintenance of system health and security and provide proactive/reactive data management support.  Design backup processes for server and associated data, must be able to provide end-to-end technical support and problem resolution, schedule and perform regular database server maintenance.  The candidate should also be able to create database management procedures, evaluate data analysis models and procedures, configure and deploys custom solution packages/settings and manage current database and new functionality as required. Upgrades, patches and migrations are just some of the tasks being performed. Gathers information concerning the capabilities of products; investigates the technical capabilities of products and competing equipment and/or solutions.  Coordinates resolution of product/service issues, upgrades, and problems.


Required Skills8-10 years’ experience with maintaining/managing/documenting  a enterprise database environmentBS Degree in Computer Science or a related field (IT/Engineering/etc.)Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a teamExcellent knowledge of data backup, recovery, security, integrity and SQLSecurity + or equivalent certificationExperience with SQL Server 2012 or newer and DB2 v10.6 or newerMust have an active TS/SCI with polygraphDesired SkillsExperience evaluating and testing COTS software functionality.Experience developing and troubleshooting work-flowsExperience identifying, researching, and testing alternative solutionsKnowledge of Agile terminology, theories and best practicesKnowledge of SQL, Java and VBAExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFamiliarity with DOD and Intelligence Community (IC) regulations, directives, and policies a plusIBM Certified Database AdministratorExperience withWindows Server 2008 R2 or newerMicrosoft Office SuiteExperence with Cloud computing (AWS)
title: Database Administrator

details:
JOB SUMMARY:  

Define, create, and maintain the enterprise data model with focus on Oracle RDBMS.  Also maintain and administer Postgres RDBMS.

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES (other duties as assigned):

·         Administer all database objects - tables, clusters, indexes, view, sequences, packages and procedures on both the Oracles and Postgres databases.  Schedule and optimize maintenance tasks such as reorg/re-index, update statistics to ensure optimal performance and availability.   Reorganize databases structures at regular intervals to provide an efficient database environment that will maximize productivity and improve performance.

·         Analyze, test, and implement database design supporting various business applications for development, integrated test and production environments. 

·         Design, implement, and enforce the company's data security policies.  Responsible for logical and physical database design, backup and recovery strategy including disaster recovery, high availability, load strategy design and implementation, security, and change management. 

·         Identify and lead strategic database initiatives, including upgrades, new technology and processes (e.g., patches, compliance, security), and new roles; engaging the appropriate cross functional technical resources to determine solutions, recommend outcomes and drive project plan through to timely completion.

·         Provide first level application support in Oracle, Postgres, and Microsoft database environments running on Linux and Windows servers. Facilitate application development and customer problem resolution with optimum speed and efficiency. 

·         Conduct application transaction volume and traffic analysis assessing the impact of database performance.  Monitor database growth and usage to ensure optimum performance and stability in production environment.

·         Design and configure database architecture, including hardware and physical layout. 

·         Perform data refreshes on request to support development and model office test environments.



SCOPE & IMPACT:  

This position will support the mission critical databases - Agile, RMS, OTM, SOM, and SOA.



MINIMIUM REQUIREMENTS:  
·         Bachelor’s degree with 4 - 6 years of relevant experience or equivalent
·         Up to 10% travel 
·         One to three years of supervisory / leadership experience
·         Technical Skills: Oracle Real Applications Cluster (RAC); Oracle Automatic Storage Management (ASM); Oracle Enterprise Manager; Oracle Active Guard
·         Project management, System development lifecycle, written and oral communication skills
 
PREFERED REQUIREMENTS:  
·         Oracle DBA certification
 
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None.
 
PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT: 
Office environment / no specific or unusual physical or environmental demands.
 
CORE ATTRIBUTES:
Communicate Transparently
Lead the Team 
Impact and Influence 
Deliver Results
Coach and Develop 
 
OTHER DUTIES:  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the incumbent for this job.  Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
title: Database Administrator

details:
The Database Support Services team is responsible for the care and maintenance of database solutions, including IT systems, applications, processes and infrastructure, that have passed through the development cycle and are serving the business needs of our customers.  In accordance with the IT strategy, the team maintains current or near current levels of software, patches, features, and configurations for the IT systems.  In addition, the team provides support as the IT systems are extended to users in new locations globally.

Essential Functions

Strategy & Planning

Partner with business, technical, and vendor contacts to discuss requirements for and review proposals for new IT solutions.   Participate in the selection process for new IT solutions.
Assist in creating quarterly work plan of activities in support of customer/vendor goals and/or strategy.  Assist in determining resource requirements needed to support the activities.
Provide input to creation of rolling maintenance plan of activities 6-12 months in advance. 

Acquisition & Deployment

Review project requests describing database user needs to estimate time and cost required to successfully accomplish a project.
Participate, with responsibility for some major deliverables, in the transition of support for new IT solutions that have been implemented for customer by the Database Technical Services team or other implementation partners.

Operational Management

Establish and maintain working relationship with representatives from the customer/vendor.
Provide regular, clear, and consistent communication (written and oral) on the status of projects, issues, and deliverables to representatives from the customer/vendor. 
Develop and maintain understanding of key processes, schedules, cycles, profiles, etc. for the technical systems in use by a customer. 
Document key processes, schedules, cycles, profiles, etc. for the technical systems in use by a customer. 
Define, implement, and maintain service levels objectives, based on the metrics, for the IT systems and processes in use by a customer/vendor. 
Monitor key performance indicators and implement enhancements to improve/maintain performance/productivity at acceptable levels.
Establish and maintain a 24x7 global support model for all environments (Oracle EBS and Core databases) in support of customer.
Participate in the planning and execution of the monthly maintenance process, including patches, system configurations, and preventative maintenance activities, across all production environments in support of customer.
Partner with Developers, System and Network administrators in a multinational environment to support and improve system performance and stability.
Establish and calculate optimum values for database parameters.
Work with Oracle Support to facilitate analysis of and resolution to technical issues.
Participate in rotation for after-hours support of environments.
Assume primary responsibility during problem resolution.  Uses troubleshooting techniques to identify root cause and implements permanent corrective action to resolve issues. 
Manage medium projects & change requests, using basic project management techniques.  Documents and manages project scope.  Documents project plan in terms of work breakdown structure, effort, and schedule.    Creates, maintains, and executes project plan. Works with business team to resolve project issues.   Assesses and mitigates project risk.

Incidental Functions

Monitor the database environment to identify and recommend alternatives/enhancements.
Consult with end users and developers to recommend the most appropriate database solution.
Assist application development with database design considerations.
Assist in the designs of data models.
Assist in performance tuning, and monitoring of all system tiers.
Maintain current knowledge of the technology workspace in terms of current state, future possibilities, forthcoming technologies, and their relevance and impact.
Assist with other projects as may be required to contribute to efficiency and effectiveness of the work.
Participate in hiring activities and fulfilling affirmative action obligations and ensuring compliance with the equal employment opportunity policy.
Minimal travel is required.
Work outside the standard office 7.5 hour workday as required.





Position Requirements

Formal Education & Certification

Bachelor degree or foreign equivalent in related field or equivalent experience. 
Certifications in Oracle 11g/12c Administration, a plus.
Certifications in Oracle 11g/12c RAC Administration, a plus.

Knowledge & Experience

5+ years IT experience.
Strong knowledge of the entire Oracle database and Oracle Applications environment and architecture.
Strong technical expertise and functional exposure to Oracle eBusiness Suite release 12 (12.2 preferred)
A minimum of 5 years working with customers to build and formulate business requirements.
At least 5 years developing documentation, white papers and presentations suitable for peers and immediate management.
Use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
3+ years experience in working with Oracle database technologies.
3+ years experience of both functional and technical knowledge in supporting Oracle eBusiness Suite in an enterprise setting.
3+ years experience in supporting some of the following technologies: Oracle SSO, OIM, OBIEE, Data Guard, Oracle RAC, ASM, and Sun Cluster on Linux and Solaris systems.
Experience with Oracle Value Chain Planning/Demantra preferred.
Understand and execute the IT processes of Incident Management, Problem Management, Change Management, and Configuration Management.  


Personal Attributes

Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Good presentation and interpersonal skills.
Ability to conduct research into database issues, standards, and products.
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Strong ability to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.


Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, pregnancy, genetic information, creed, citizenship status, marital status, or any other consideration prohibited by law or contract. VEVRAA Federal Contractor requesting priority referral of protected veterans. 

This position can be filled in Cleveland, OH or Minneapolis, MN.

Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future.
title: Database Administrator

details:
Description:Job Summary  The Defense and Intelligence Group of Leidos has an immediate opening for a Multifunctional Field Service Engineer (M-FSE) with database administration experience in Charlottesville, VA.  The Biometrics Automated Toolset – Army (BAT-A) is an established Identity Management and Collection solution that has led the effort to identify foes in the War on Terror. Leidos assists in this worldwide effort by aiding the US Military in the utilization of biometrics to positively identify individuals in a shifting world of identities. The BAT-A M-FSE supports the Warfighter by sustaining the BAT-A systems and databases. Team Leidos has been providing world class development and field support to the BAT-A program since its inception in 2004. We have worked side-by-side with our DoD Partners to develop, deploy, maintain, train and operate the BAT-A wherever it has been deployed as a force multiplier in the critical war on terror mission. This four year program will provide operations, maintenance, software engineering services and hardware procurement services, and associated support for all devices associated with the BAT-A system. These services shall focus on supporting the Warfighter needs by sustaining adequate support functions.  The BAT-A M-FSE in Charlottesville provides support to deployed M-FSEs, users and operators by troubleshooting BAT-A technical and database issues; implements policies and procedures regarding how problems are identified, received, documented, distributed, and corrected; and ensures maximum issue resolutions in minimum time.
  Primary Responsibilities List daily duties and/or specific job responsibilities. •System start-up, initialization, and shut down •Software patch implementation and testing and system maintenance checks and repairs •Security checks of daily logs •Daily operation of servers •Transaction reconciliation •Implementing system upgrades, including planning, scheduling, testing, and coordinating and managing system network availability. •Implement IA patches, including QA and QC checks •Administer database organizations, standards, controls, procedures, and documentation. •Provide technical consulting in the definition, design, and creation of a database environment. •Assist applications development staff and users on database solutions to business problems, data architectures, database management system facilities and capabilities, and the operation and tuning of databases. •Implement and maintain databases with respect to access methods, access time, batch processes, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, and statistical methods. Includes maintenance of database dictionaries, and integration of systems through database design and implementation. •Document JCL, shell scripts and batch processes. •Ensure that documentation is complete and up-to-date. •Manage and test backup and recovery plans. •Monitor the replication schema.  •Develop and implement database monitoring tools. •Troubleshoot, track, and monitor data flow. •Communicate regularly with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity, security and serving as the resident database expert for TBS users. •Interact with customer in response to reported problems and defining requirements. •Collaborate and coordinate with outside organizations periodically as necessary. •Perform other IT project work as assigned on a “best effort” basis. •Perform other duties as assigned by the Operations Manager.  External Referral Eligible Qualifications:Basic Qualifications 
•Bachelor's degree in a relevant field and 4+ years of experience managing systems, including servers. •Microsoft SQL server administration experience with familiarity of MS SQL syntax. •Ability to install and maintain MS SQL Server 2008R2. •Experience with Windows Server 2012R2.•Experience with and knowledge of advanced data mining techniques. •Ability to create data maps and load data and databases onto servers. •Experience with scripting for the purposes of data manipulation and automating redundant tasks. •Proficient in the use of PC’s and all programs included in the Microsoft Office application suite. •Currently possess an active DoD TS/SCI security clearance.   Preferred Qualifications •Previous experience with biometric applications in support of GWOT. •Knowledge of programming languages in Microsoft .NET, Visual Basic or Visual C#, Web Administration (IIS), and software and hardware test procedures. •Military and/or national intelligence background with a clear understanding of the military structure, mission and responsibilities. •Aptitude for learning new scripting languages and database syntax and the ability to implement those new skills.Leidos Overview:Leidos is a global science and technology solutions leader working to solve the world’s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company’s 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported pro forma annual revenues of approximately $10 billion for the fiscal year ended January 1, 2016 after giving effect to the recently completed combination of Leidos with Lockheed Martin's Information Systems & Global Solutions business (IS&GS). For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. The company’s diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in accordance with relevant Laws. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Database Administrator

details: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation. Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline. Job Description The Database Administrator II will manage and maintain the SQL server(s) for our clients. This includes, but is not limited to, database configuration, schema design, user access, backups, recovery, scripting, patching, migration, replication, performance and capacity monitoring. The position will also involve working with Project Managers, Business Analysts, on-site technical personnel, vendors and clients. This is an on-site position in downtown Fort Wayne, Indiana.  Job Requirements   [Required] 3+ years of DBA experience with SQL Server in an enterprise environment  [Required] Experience working with, creating and modifying SQL views and stored procedures  [Required] Working knowledge of Windows Server operating systems  [Required] Experience in working with customers  [Required] Good analytical skills  [Optional] Experience with SQL Server Integration Services  [Optional] Experience with MySQL databases  Your Application If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format. details:
FOJP Service Corporation has an exciting Data Quality Administrator position available in their NYC office!
FOJP is looking for a Data Quality Administrator join their expanding insurance and risk management department. As the Data Quality Administrator you will be providing support for the collection and maintenance of client underwriting data used for program insurance marketing, financial modeling, and for preparing coverage summaries.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


Prepare timely underwriting data for market submissions and provide insurers with audit information for all lines utilizing the firms Risk Management Information System (RMIS).
Manage the departments 120-day renewal process ensuring timely system updates determined by departments Best Practices.
Update policy renewal information to include proper policy, and related documents, file storage adhering to the firm’s best practices for clients to have timely and accurate information.
Maintain client exposure data used for underwriting.
Provide accurate schedules of insurance along with detailed summary of insurance as required by client interaction.
Maintain updated RMIS user manual and other related manuals used by the department.
Assist FOJP training coordinator with client RMIS training and be the subject matter expert for FOJP colleagues.
Performs other duties or special projects as required or assigned.


PERFORMANCE METRICS:

 Responds to all client questions same day, preferably within 2 hours or refer to client service manager
 Completes projects within timeframe specified upon receipt of assignment, with a high degree of quality, accuracy and attention to detail.




Education/Certification:

 Bachelor’s degree required.

 
Experience Required

 Prior insurance industry experience preferred.
 Customer Relationship Management software experience preferred.


Skills/Abilities:

 Excellent client service skills, strong listening skills and the ability to articulate a plan for resolution clearly, in person and via phone.
 Ability to understand the level of urgency and importance of a request in relation to business needs, and respond appropriately.
 Demonstrated technical problem solving and diagnostic skills.
 Proven attention to detail and accuracy.
 Self-starter, committed to excellence, willing to take ownership of responsibilities; possesses high level of positive energy and drive.
 Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities, and the ability to follow through with task completion.
 Advanced Excel skills to work with vast amounts of client data
title: Database Administrator

details:
Location: Lincoln, RI (Corporate Information Systems)

Are you looking for a job in a growing industry with new products, new markets and new technology?

With locations across the country, Amica Mutual Insurance Company offers opportunities to join this dynamic field with a financially strong and respected insurance provider. Amica, based in Lincoln, RI, is a national writer of auto, home, marine and umbrella
insurance. Amica Life Insurance Company, a wholly owned subsidiary, offers a full line of life insurance products.


We are recognized as a leader in customer service and credit this success to our 3,700 employees in 44 offices across the country. Our benefits package includes high-quality medical, dental and vision coverage, short-term and long-term disability insurance
and more.

Our office located in Lincoln, RI is seeking a Database Administrator. This position involves designing, implementing and maintaining databases to ensure the availability and integrity of corporate data in several Database Management Systems (DBMS) on distributed
platforms.


Job Functions and Responsibilities:

• Utilize tools to monitor the performance, reliability and availability of the corporate database environments
• Develops, validates and implements procedures to ensure the recoverability and availability of corporate databases to meet business Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO)
• Responsible for 600+ Microsoft SQL server installs with High availability Microsoft clustering, and database mirroring/availability groups across multiple data centers
• Supports day-to-day operational tasks including management of accounts, handling incident and service request tickets, priority incident resolution, and operational maintenance activities such as database backup/restores, and SQL job/script maintenance
• Provides database and SQL Tuning expertise through recommendations to application developers and other core teams
• Manages the storage environments for the SQL Server databases, including planning for additional storage, maintaining optimal sizing, monitoring space and providing growth statistics
• Creates and executes SQL Server backup and recovery policies and maintains integrity and reliability of access to information

• Works with staff and vendors to implement technical solutions and diagnose database system disruptions
• Provides guidance to other IT development personnel


Job Requirements:

• A Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 4 years of database administration experience in multiple and/or complex areas or, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Commitment to attend training and/or industry seminars as appropriate, to stay abreast of current technologies
• Experience deploying and troubleshooting SQL Transactional replication and Availability Groups
• Ability to learn new technologies
• IDERA Diagnostic Manager experience is preferred
• Experience with MongoDB database administration, Teradata, NoSQL and cloud-based records management is a plus

Equal Opportunity Policy: All qualified applicants who are authorized to work in the United States will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, ethnicity, age, genetic information, disability or sexual
orientation. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act prohibits discrimination on the basis of age with respect to individuals who are 40 years of age or older. Employees are subject to the provisions of the Workers' Compensation Act.

title: Database Administrator

details:
Position Description

The Senior Database Administrator role at Union will provide both operational and strategic leadership in the establishment of our Enterprise Data Warehouse. This is a unique opportunity to establish new processes and standards, be involved in architecture,
design and development of a highly visible, key strategic initiative. The successful candidate will bring strong Microsoft SQL Server product suite knowledge, experience establishing new processes, and work well in fast paced, collaborative environment. This
position will play a key role in the transition from traditional reporting to a more dynamic, real-time analytics environment ensuring a foundation to deliver information to internal consumers at all levels in the organization.


Position Accountabilities:

• Enhance and maintain a multi-tier enterprise data warehouse environment including processes for code and data object promotion, data backups, and disaster recovery capabilities
• Work closely with IT operations to establish high performing, resilient and scalable technology environment
• Design, create and manage physical data structures designed for flexibility, scalability and resiliency to support future business needs. Lead Database Capacity planning activities.

• Provide support and assistance in sourcing data from key systems through ETL processes using SSIS and/or other methods.
• Monitor system performance and continuously identify ways to improve performance.

• Establish and Ensure that data designs follow architectural best practices and appropriate business rules
• Facilitate data integration, conformity, data quality, integrity and consolidation
• Be an advocate for best practices while balancing business value and reasonable practicality
• Create and Maintain critical data documentation and metadata that allows data to be understood and leveraged as a shared asset.
• Lead/Assist in defining database management standards, and foundational best practices.
• Facilitate understanding of high quality data management discipline throughout the corporation
• Design and Manage EDW Database and Data Object user access based on Information Security standards and Data Architecture.

• Assist in the design and translation of data requirements and logical models into physical and semantic layer data objects across the analytical data environment.
• Develop and maintain relationships across IT and across the business with special focus on roles that are heavy consumers of data for analytical purposes; anticipate customer needs and proactively develop solutions

• Influence, assist in planning/scoping new projects and expanded usage of the EDW.

• Participate in on-call rotation and/or after hours work as needed

Organizational Relationship:

This position reports to the SVP, Director of Data Warehousing & Analytics

Position Qualifications

Education and Experience:

• A Bachelor’s Degree in a technology area of study; preferably in Computer Science, MIS or Analytics
• 10+ years equivalent work experience in Information Technology
• 8+ years in a structured IT organization with a strong PMO, a variety of methodologies, and strong technical environment management disciplines

• 6+ years of experience as a production Database Administrator; preferably in a shared or Enterprise Data Warehouse environment

• 2+ years of experience in banking and/or financial services preferred
• Deep experience in managing a production environment; Change Control, performance tuning & monitoring,

• SQL Query development skills for analyzing and profiling data
• Experience with multiple SDLC methodologies – Waterfall and Agile

Knowledge & Skills:

• Excellent communication, leadership and collaboration skills
• Extensive expertise with Microsoft SQL Server Products (SQL Server Enterprise, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)
• Experience managing database systems within a virtual infrastructure environment (such as VMWare)
• Experience with Enterprise Data Warehouse initiatives including ETL\ELT, Physical Database development, Semantic/Data Access Layer Development (Shared Views, Tabular Models , developing solutions for shared data usage)
• Experience with Physical Data Modeling and Design in developing processes to manage database development, principles, and standards
• Competency with some leading data profiling tools (such as SQL, BI tools, etc.) is a plus.

• Exposure to and understanding of Analytical Architectures 
• Strong analytical, problem solving, and work management skills 
• Ability to communicate effectively (verbal and written) across all levels of the organization using metrics reporting, performance trending, status updates and product evaluations

• Proactive Leadership style; self-starter and strong attention to detail
• Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, MS Project, Visio, SharePoint)


No Search assistance

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. We maintain a drug-free workplace.

details:
Apex Systems is partnered with a A large financial services client in Malvern, PA who is looking for someone with strong Oracle Database Development/DBA experience and solid GoldenGate experience. They are not looking for a DBA who simply takes care of database systems. They need someone who has application development (Testing & Development environments) experience with Oracle database, PL/SQL etc.

This person will be:

Developing new customizations and applications in testing and development environments.
Maintaining & upgrading existing applications in development, testing and production environment.
Providing troubleshooting of applications in production environment.


Desired Skill Sets:

8-10+ years in Oracle database development/administration experience with ideally 3+ years of Oracle GoldenGate experience
Experienced with GoldenGate installation and configuration.
Creation of GoldenGate parameter files for data transformation.
Experience with GoldenGate Integrated data capture for Oracle.
Familiar with GoldenGate Data Conflict Avoidance techniques.

Experience with GoldenGate configuration in an Oracle RAC environment.

Strong written and verbal skills with a focus on customer service.

Experience in High Availability environment (24x7) / High Availability Databases.

GoldenGate integration with SQL Sever a plus.

Oracle certifications a plus.

details:
An established software development firm with a proven track record of providing the most advanced securities processing capabilities to companies that trade securities, Shadow Financial Systems recognizes that the right people are the key to its continued success. For qualified candidates, the company provides a highly creative and dynamic environment that encourages innovation and recognizes employees for their achievements. We are a growing organization that revolves around our bold ethos of teamwork. Culture fit is important to us, so the right new team member should have the following qualities:
·         Strong communication skills
·         Out of the box thinking and problem-solving abilities
·         Be customer-driven
·         Enjoy working as part of a team
You will be working in our office, located in Piscataway, NJ. This entry-level position is ideal for applicants with a technical background who enjoy working in a cutting-edge environment. The Database Administrator is responsible for all aspects of both internal and external database administration including planning, implementation, configuration, support, usage monitoring and tuning. As a DBA, you will collaborate and interface with a strong development team in relation to the database infrastructure, work hard, learn a lot, and have fun.
WHAT YOU GET TO DO:
·         Implement database schema, tables, procedures and permissions, clustering, mirroring, replication and failover
·         Analyze and tune database instances for optimal efficiency
·         Restore and recover corrupted databases
·         Install and test upgrades and patches
·         Provide 24/7/365 support 
·         Establish and implement database disaster recovery plans and monitor the automated backups daily
·         Capacity monitoring and planning
·         Troubleshoot and diagnose production problems
ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
·         Performs on-going review of database environment to manage growth
·         Coordination with other departments to anticipate and service needs in relation to the database infrastructure
·         Some overnight and weekend work is required
BENEFITS & PERKS:
·         Competitive salary
·         Medical, dental, and vision insurance
·         401k
·         Generous PTO
·         Producing meaningful work in a collaborative, supportive environment that encourages cross-team learning opportunities
Shadow Financial is a strong team because of the diverse backgrounds of our staff. This includes professional background, subject matter expertise, culture, race/ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, language, political beliefs, and hobbies. We strongly encourage women, minorities, veterans and people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE ROLE: Experience, Competencies and Education
·         4-year college degree in related field or equivalent experience
·         4 years or more of database administration experience on Oracle RDBMS
·         Oracle 11g and 12C RDMS
·         Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
·         Proven experience in database infrastructure planning and development 
·         Excellent written and oral communication skills 
·         Excellent interpersonal skills 
·         Highly self-motivated and directed 
·         Keen attention to detail 
·         Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities 
·         Exceptional customer service orientation
ADDITIONAL DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS:
·         Any of the following Oracle certifications (for Oracle 11G, Oracle 12C):
o    Oracle Database Administrator Certified Associate
o    Oracle Database Administrator Certified Professional
o    Oracle Database Administrator Certified Master
o    Oracle Database SQL Certified Expert
·         Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2008, 2012, 2014, 2016.
·         Experience with DB Visit
·         Experience with Solar Winds

title: Database Administrator

details:
Job Description We are searching for smart, driven, hybrid Oracle DBAs with System Architect/ Engineer experience to join one of our cornerstone business solutions teams supporting a classified customer. The selected candidate will plan, oversee, and implement critical database migrations and applications decoupling solutions to separate multiple enterprise applications from the customer's human resource applications and database hosting environment. With the human resource upgrade and cloud migration project, there are several non-human resource applications that need to discontinue direct access to the human resource production databases and identify and implement an alternative source for referencing the human resource data. There are other non-human resource applications that require code-level decoupling from the human resource application and environment. The database architect is needed to plan, oversee, collaborate and implement the database migration, application decoupling and data referencing software and database modifications in support of the human resource upgrade. We have some tough challenges and we need people who can look past the problems and into solutions. Are you the one others reach out to for help solving tough issues? Then reach out, let’s connect.  Typical Education & Experience Typically a Bachelor's Degree and 10 years work experience or equivalent experienceRequired Skills and Education 
Candidate must have an Active Intel Security clearance with a Polygraph, candidate will not be considered without it.
6-8 years of demonstrated current work experience with Oracle 11.
6-8 years of demonstrated experience with overseeing and implementing data migrations for Oracle databases within large enterprise environments.
6+ years of demonstrated design experience with database architectures involving the decoupling of multiple enterprise systems. such as database performance, sizing, storage, tuning, and ETL.
Knowledge and understanding of database migration plans, data flow diagrams, and ETL design documentation (including source/target mapping and data dictionary information).
6-8 years of experience with data migration tools such as data pump, Oracle streams, and various ETL tools.
6+ years of demonstrated on-the-job experience with SQL and stored procedure languages, including PL/SQL
Ability to document the functionality included in software modules, the degree of interdependence between software modules, and develop recommendations regarding how to reach the loose decoupling of applications functionality.
4-6 years of experience with AWS architectures and AWS products including RDS as well experience with Oracle 12 is beneficial for migrations of non-HR databases to the cloud environment.
6 years of demonstrated experience providing explanations of complex technical procedures and process clearly and accurately to both technical and non-technical audiences.
8+ years of experience with SQL Developer to include database queries and insert statements.
8+ years of experience with Excel.
Preferred Skills and Education 
4-6 years of demonstrated current work experience with human resource application and databases
Flexible
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Excellent verbal and written communication
Team player
About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Job Description

 GDIT is seeking a MS SQL DBA to support our newly awarded Army Analytics Group (AAG) contract located in Fairfield, California. The ideal candidate must have the following: Advanced MS SQL 2008 R2 Administration, Configuration and Tuning,  Advanced Windows 2008R2 tuning for MS SQL 2008R2,  Intermediate/Advanced Windows 2008R2 Administration and Configuration,  Advanced DISA Gold, Army Gold Master configurations on MS SQL 2008 Databases, Intermediate App Detective MS SQL 2008 scanning and remediating according to   Industry best practices. 
Performs complex systems development and design work that may include logic design, I/O design, firmware development, model formulation, manufacturing and development cost projections, computer architecture analysis and design, and analog or digital systems engineering.

Participates in the upgrading of operating systems and design of systems enhancements.
Provides input for documentation on new or existing systems.

Identifies, analyzes, and resolves system problems.
Provides system/equipment/specialized training and technical guidance.
Determines system specifications, input/output processes, and working parameters for hardware/software compatibility.
May provide guidance and work leadership to less-experienced systems engineers.

Participates in special projects as assigned.


Education

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience.

details:
LJT & Associates, Inc. provides a wide range of engineering and other support services to the U.S. Government and International customers.  We are a certified large business with expertise in the analysis, design, development, and implementation of a variety of engineering and hardware integration solutions. The company has experienced significant growth and seeks qualified candidates to support continued growth in all of our business sectors.LJT provides a very competitive benefits package. Health coverage begins on first day of employment!

Duties & Responsibilities


SQL Server Design and Development, SQL Server backup/recovery strategies
Installation, configuration and maintenance of all databases which are client-server based.
Maintain software versions, patches and fixes.
Participate in monitoring, testing, and performing recovery operations with stored and archived data and images using network storage devices.
Administer databases including monitoring and tuning databases to provide optimal performance.
Identify poorly performing queries, stored procedures, views, and tables as well as taking steps to improve performance.
Provide ongoing system support for database engineering and configuration.
#CB

Qualifications


A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related discipline is required. This position requires a minimum of three (3) to five (5) years experience, of which at least three years must be specialized experience in administrating Microsoft SQL database and server.
Minimum of 3 years as SQL database administrator on large scale, multi-user enterprise systems.
The candidate must possess experiences in working with full life-cycle Information Technology projects, as well as a proficiency in the environments of J2EE, EJB, Sun Solaris, IBM WebSphere, Oracle, DB/2, Hibernate, JMS/MQ Series, Web Service, SOAP, and XML.
General experience includes operations experience on a large-scale computer system or a multi-server local area network, broad knowledge and experience with RDBMS and database technologies, and the capability to determine database and application performance capabilities.


Other Knowledge Skills & Abilities

- Proven experience and expertise in database design, data modeling, and performance tuning of Microsoft SQL database server.- Ability to work independently on multiple tasks with little supervision and oversight.- Demonstrated excellent analytical, trouble-shooting, and problem-resolving skills.- Strong oral and written communications skills and the ability to present technical ideas.- CompTia Security+ certification required.- US Citizenship required.- A full background investigation will be required.LJT is an Equal Opportunity EmployerEOE/M/F/V/D

Under minimal supervision, performs moderately complex to complex work assignments and problem resolution across systems, processes, or channels. Performs multiple team roles (team member, team co-leader) in the delivery of technical solutions.Job RequirementsABOUT USAA     USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.In each of the past five years, we've been a top-40 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For®, and we've ranked among Victory Media's Top 10 Military Friendly® Employers 13 years straight. We embrace a robust veteran workforce and encourage veterans to apply.ABOUT USAA ITOur most important qualification isn't technical, it's human. Here, we don't just sit in front of a screen. We stand behind our 11 million members who rely on us every day.We are over 3,000 employees strong, a passionately supportive and collaborative team built on Agile principles. We've been a top-two Computerworld 100 Best Places to Work in IT five years in a row and were recently named a Top 50 Employer for Minority Engineers & IT by Workforce Diversity Magazine.See what it's like to work for a company where your passion meets our purpose:USAA Information Technology: A Realistic Preview PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Acquires and applies intermediate knowledge of database design and management including modeling, creation and maintenance of database objects.
Applies in-depth understanding of database tools and utilities and at least one DBMS platform, as well as highly developed SQL and database performance tuning skills.
Performs evaluation, modification and integration functions associated with vendor supplied database software.
Ensures business continuity by developing and implementing highly available database systems and database recovery plans and
procedures. Liaises with database software vendors and external technical support on issues.
Serves as a resource to less experienced team members on escalated issues of a routine nature.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
4+ years relevant database design or administration and/or systems/development life cycle experience.
Experience with technical programming languages and/or database design or database management systems.

PREFERRED 
Experience working with NoSQL databases with a preference of Cassandra, Redis, and/or Couchbase
Experience working with traditional RDBMS on Linux with a preference of Oracle, DB2 LUW, and/or PostgreSQL
Experience with either Amazon Web Services or Azure, managing multi-region deployments
Experience writing automating database maintenance processes and monitoring using shell scripts or Python.
Experience providing appropriate Database Performance tuning support with regards to storage I/O, bufferpools, query access plan assessment and creation of required database structures including indexes.
Experience providing project database consulting and oversight for complex projects including physical design, query analysis, and database implementation.

BENEFITS
USAA's most valuable resource is our 28,000+ employees. We promote a culture of diversity and inclusion, encouraging varied perspectives and ideas.
Our team enjoys world-class benefits, pay and highly competitive reward opportunities, including comprehensive healthcare, wellness and wealth building programs, employee resource groups, 401K matching dollar-for-dollar up to 8% of pay, career planning and continuing education.
We promote a strong work-life balance with a variety of on-site services and conveniences depending on location, including a daycare, health center and pharmacy, multiple dining options, company stores, covered parking and free fitness centers. USAA is a casual dress environment.
The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.
At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals
title: Database Administrator

details:
LJT & Associates, Inc. Provides a wide range of engineering and advanced technical and program management solutions to our U.S Government and international customers. We are a certified large business with expertise in the analysis, design, development, and implementation of a variety of engineering and hardware integration solutions. The company has experienced significant growth and seeks qualified candidates to support continued growth in all of our business sectors. We are searching for a candidate to provide expertise in support of the Defense Information Systems Agency, one our primary customers on Tinker, AFB OKLJT provides a very competitive benefits package. Health coverage begins on first day of employment!

Duties & Responsibilities

The Junior to Senior Oracle Database Administrator will provide technical skills such as system management, system processing strategies, Oracle and Unix hardware and software application processing, Oracle application scheduling, Oracle and Unix systems administration, applications set-up, processing and recoveries, data base administration, computer performance analysis, workload balancing, event management, monitor, troubleshoot, and provide problem resolution for communications, application and customer application support.Duties and Responsibilities:
Experience and skills in Oracle RDBMS versions 9i through 12c, Oracle Applications (Financials), Oracle Application Server (OAS), Oracle 10g Application Server (10gAS), PL/SQL, Oracle Portal, RMAN, SQLnet, and Oracle Application Express (APEX) products to include building new Oracle instances and schemas; migration of application database subsystems; troubleshooting and diagnostics of Oracle RDBMS system and vendor software; and monitoring and tuning Oracle RDBMS.
 Provide technical support such as senior level database management support in the broad range of maintenance and utilization of the Oracle Database software operating an enterprise architecture of UNIX, LINUX, AIX NT, WINDOWS, SOLARIS, HP-UX, and other MID-Tier systems.
Provide senior level technical guidance in resolving operational/production issues to include hands-on support of the computers and on-the-job training of Government personnel within this area.
Provide technical support for SQL*net, PL/SQL, External Procedures, Oracle security as defined by the DISA database Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG).  Resolve problems that occur during program testing and in production modes.
Coordinate activities with Network Administrator to ensure hardware and software configuration, installation, and setup are optimized to any technical solutions devised during analysis, design, or creation of program changes.
Provide technical advice and consulting services during development of appli­cation programs and system interfaces.  Resolve problems that occur during program testing and in production modes.
Perform trend analysis on system performance, recommend configuration changes and participate in the planning activities to schedule system up­grades, backup and recovery.
Monitor contractor’s configuration management systems and perform audits to ensure contract compliance
Support the administration of task requirements, configuration change control and configuration management as required
#CB

Qualifications


BA or BS degree and 5 years of direct configuration management experience is required or 7+ years related experience
In lieu of formal education, 9 years of years of experience may be substituted
AA degree may substitute for 2 years of experience
Must be able to obtain DoD Security Clearance
CompTIA Security+ Certification


Other Knowledge Skills & Abilities

Must have or be able to obtain CompTIA Security+ Certification.LJT is an Equal Opportunity EmployerEOE/M/F/V/D
title: Database Administrator

details:
Overview
Vencore is a proven provider of information solutions, engineering and analytics for the U.S. Government. With more than 40 years of experience working in the defense, civilian and intelligence communities, Vencore designs, develops and delivers high impact, mission-critical services and solutions to overcome its customers most complex problems. Headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia, Vencore employs 3,800 engineers, analysts, IT specialists and other professionals who strive to be the best at everything they do. Vencore is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

Responsibilities: 
Designs, creates, and maintains Oracle databases in a client/server and web environment for mission critical production applications.
Conducts quality control and auditing of databases in a client/server and web environment to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data.
Troubleshoots production problems related to software applications and database transactions in application code as well as in stored procedures.
Advises users on access to various client/server and web databases.
Designs, implements, and maintains complex databases with respect to access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, and statistical methods.
Responsible for building and deploying database updates to real-time production, working with several environments and QA process.
Applies knowledge and experience with database technologies, development methodologies, and front-end/back-end programming languages (e.g., SQL).
Performs database programming and supports systems design.
Designs, develops and normalizes database schemas.
Provides maintenance of database dictionaries, overall monitoring of standards and procedures, file design and storage, and integration of systems through database design.

Analyzes user needs, develops user stories and decomposes to database solutions.
Addresses problems of systems integration, compatibility, and multiple platforms.
Reviews and optimizes PL/SQL statements.
Evaluates database design tradeoffs, impacts on user expectations and performance levels.Performs as part of an agile team, utilizing Kanban and Scrum best practices. Collaborates frequently with other team members. Mentors other DBAs across the agile teams. Shares best practices with all DBAs. 

Qualifications

Required


5+ years of relevant experience, with a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering or other Technical degree preferred
Proficient in Oracle, specifically the ability to:

Install an Oracle database, set up infrastructure
Develop tables, stored procedures, functions
Apply upgrades, troubleshooting and monitoring procedures

Demonstrated ability to explain technical issues clearly/accurately to technical/non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to lead a team and mentor other DB Developers with adjusting priorities and deadlines
Desired Skills:
Oracle certification
Experience in the following technologies and tools: Microsoft .NET, Visual Basic (VB), C#
Proficient in PL/SQL

Experience with the following technologies:
.NET core
Node.js
Angular JS
HTML 5
Bootstrap


GitHub, JIRA experience
Familiarity or experience with DHS, specifically USCIS
Experience working in an Agile team
